Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I wish to thank you, Madam President, for convening this meeting.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also wish to thank Assistant Secretary-General Oscar Fernandez-Taranco for his briefing.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Lithuania is deeply concerned about the sharp deterioration of the situation in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: External forces and local provocateurs continue to fuel separatism and hatred, destabilizing the situation in eastern Ukraine on the eve of the 25 May elections.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The scenario is dangerously familiar.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Where there was no unrest, unrest and chaos are being created by pro-Russian militias, again anonymous and without insignia, and again carrying modern models of assault weapons as seen in Crimea.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Again, considerable Russian troops are massed on Ukraine's borders.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Again, the external anti-Ukranian and anti-Western propaganda machine is in full swing, inciting suspicion, mistrust and hatred waiting to explode.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine's traitor Yanukovich, who abandoned his country and fled, opening the floodgates to Crimea's annexation, is being pushed again into the daylight to clear the way for Ukraine's further dismemberment.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Groups of provocateurs in the hundreds, supported by pro-Russian militias, are attacking buildings of Ukraine's State institutions and declaring independence from Ukraine, as well as announcing plans for new referendums on joining Russia, in spite of the fact that recent opinion polls clearly show that the predominant majority of people in the region see their future inextricably linked to Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In fact, about 65 per cent of the region's residents, according to opinion polls, have expressed their desire to remain part of Ukraine, while only 18.2 per cent want to join Russia.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Tragically, bloodshed is happening where there was no bloodshed before pro-Russian militants started their creeping secessionist provocations.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is as clear as day that, in spite of the reassurances we heard from Moscow a few weeks ago, military aggression against Ukraine and its sovereignty, independence, and territorial integrity has not stopped with Crimea.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My Government strongly condemns the actions of the separatist groups and their sponsors in the Donetsk region, as well as in the regions of Luhansk and Kharkiv.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Lithuania supports the efforts of the Government of Ukraine to resolve this complex and unpredictable situation in a peaceful way.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine's Government has reached out repeatedly to the separatists.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the most difficult of political and economic circumstances, Ukraine's acting President Turchinov has decided to prepare a law on decentralization, granting more powers to the regions.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Acting Prime Minister Yatseniuk has clearly stated that the Government must respond to people's desire to have more regional authority.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That decision is an important step forward, showing the flexibility and readiness of legitimate Ukrainian authorities to heed its population and engage constructively.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Prime Minister Yatseniuk also reassured the Russian-speaking population regarding the use of the Russian language.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Furthermore, amnesty was offered to all militants who laid down arms and returned to seeking a peaceful solution to existing issues.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is obvious that the Ukrainian Government is doing everything possible, under such dramatic circumstances, to respond to the legitimate needs and concerns of the population, to curb corruption and impunity, which had reigned under Yanukovich, to re-establish law and order and the authority of the State and to address the problems the Government inherited from years of neglect and mismanagement.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We fully support those efforts and once again stress the extraordinary restraint and patience with which Ukraine's Government has continued to respond to the unending provocations and efforts to dismember the State by armed pro-Russian militants and separatists.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: At the same time, when the existence of a State is put in danger, we understand and support the right of Ukraine to defend itself in the face of external aggression and to tackle militant separatism and continuous provocations in order to protect the State and its population from a further escalation of violence.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international community and members of the Council should not be fooled by the pronouncements of the likes of Yanukovich and his corrupt cronies.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine are being threatened, and that threat is a threat to the security and stability of the whole region and Europe, with serious international repercussions.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge the Russian Federation to call back its troops from the Ukrainian border, to stop supporting separatist groups and to cease all other actions aimed at destabilizing Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The meeting among the United States, Russia, Ukraine and the European Union foreseen for 17 April in Geneva wold offer a viable chance for dialogue and diplomacy.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on Russia not to waste that opportunity.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The human stakes of what is happening in Ukraine are extremely high.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The lives of innocent civilians are at risk, yet we are being bombarded by Russian disinformation and propaganda, while the Ukrainians are being confronted by incitement and violence.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian media and Government spokespersons are spreading fiction, so we must tonight focus on facts.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council has heard, these last weeks, Russia disclaim any intention of occupying or invading.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council has heard it publicly, and we have heard it privately.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, the fact is that the armed seizure of buildings in six eastern Ukrainian towns yesterday, and several more today, mirrors the tactics Russian forces used in the early stages of the Crimea invasion.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Then, too, officials from the Russian Federation spoke early on in the crisis and disclaimed any intention of occupying or invading.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the earlier Crimean case, highly organized, well-equipped and professional forces wearing Russian military uniforms and military gear without identifying insignia moved in first to take control of Crimean Government and security facilities, before being later replaced by regular Russian military forces.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Then, too, Russia said it was acting to protect minorities' rights.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But the whole world now knows that they were not.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe has reported, the minorities at risk in Crimea are Tatars and Ukrainians.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council has heard that there are no Russian troops in eastern Ukraine, but the fact is that many of the armed units that we have seen were outfitted in bullet-proof vests and camouflage uniforms with insignia removed.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those armed units, some wearing black and orange Saint George's ribbons - associated with Russian Victory Day celebrations - raised Russian and separatist flags over seized buildings and have called for referendums and union with Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We know who is behind that; indeed, the only entity in the area capable of those coordinated, professional military actions is Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The synchronized surgical seizure of buildings yesterday occurred in towns along the main highway, followed by armed roadblocks, almost as ifa coordinated barrier were being formed between Kyiv and the major eastern cities of Donetsk and Luhansk.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council does not have to take my word for it - or even that of the Ukrainian Government - it need only witness for itself the videos of professional military shepherding thugs into a building in Kramatorsk; the photographs showing the so-called concerned citizens taking over Sloviansk, equipped exactly like the elite troops that took Crimea; or the video of a military operation in Krasny Liman by armed men with the same equipment.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council has heard laments about instability, as ifinstability were organic.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But the fact is that this is the saddest kind of instability: it is completely man-made.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This instability was written and choreographed in and by Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We continue efforts to de-escalate the situation in Ukraine and find a diplomatic path forward, which is why Secretary Kerry will participate in the Geneva talks on 17 April, which will include Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But ifthose are to be successful, Russia will have to explain why its forces continue to mass on the Ukrainian border - at least 40,000 forces - and it will have to come with constructive ideas on how to de-escalate and resolve the armed attacks on buildings in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United States stands with Ukraine and the fundamental principle that the future of Ukraine must be decided by the Ukrainian people.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also stand with international law and norms and the fundamental principle that borders are not suggestions.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On Monday, we will conclude the $1 billion loan guarantee for Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That will benefit all the Ukrainian people, including minorities.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Next week, Vice-President Biden will visit Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We strongly support concluding the agreement between Ukraine and the International Monetary Fund so that the international community can bolster Ukraine's economy.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And we will support in every way we can Ukraine's elections at the end of May so that Ukraine can advance its political transition and look to a peaceful future.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom is gravely concerned by events in eastern Ukraine, which have escalated over the past 48 hours, with armed men seizing control of Government buildings and erecting checkpoints and barricades in six different cities.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Street protests have given way to violent action.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is a dangerous escalation of an already dangerous situation.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have all seen the video footage of events over the weekend: professional, well-armed and well-equipped units wearing identical uniforms conducting coordinated military operations against Ukrainian State institutions.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is a pattern that is all too familiar.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Coming just weeks after Russian troops illegally deployed to Crimea while wearing uniforms without insignia, these events point clearly to Russia once again interfering directly in the internal affairs of Ukraine while using manufactured pretexts and military force.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Such actions are contrary to international law, have already been condemned by the international community and have been declared invalid by the General Assembly.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As a Member of the United Nations, and as a permanent member of the Security Council, Russia is obliged to refrain from the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity and political independence of any State.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yet satellite images show that there are between 35,000 and 40,000 Russian troops in the vicinity of the border with Ukraine, equipped with combat aircraft, tanks, artillery and logistical support units.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is in addition to the 25,000 Russian troops based illegally in Crimea.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Just as six weeks ago Russia denied deploying its troops to Crimea, it also now denies that it has amassed troops on Ukraine's eastern border.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It claims that the publicly available satellite images illustrating that troop deployment were taken in August 2013.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is false; additional images released on 11 April show clearly that the build-up started in early March of this year.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia's aggressive stance is a clear threat to the sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom calls on Russia immediately to redeploy its troops away from the border, cease all activity designed to heighten tensions and sow discord, and revoke the mandate given by the Federation Council on 1 March to use military force on Ukrainian soil.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Russian Federation has made little secret of its efforts to undermine the process of reconciliation in Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Rather than assisting its neighbours in rebuilding their country after the fall of a deeply corrupt regime that left the nation on the verge of bankruptcy, Russia has instead sought to destabilize the country further in pursuit of its narrow interests.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia must desist from those steps and address whatever grievances it has through dialogue, starting with the contact group talks scheduled for this coming week.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international community is not fooled by the Kremlin's use of propaganda and misinformation to spread fears among the population of eastern Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Contrary to Russian claims, the recent demonstrations in eastern cities are not organic.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They do not enjoy widespread support, and the numbers of genuine protestors on the streets pale in comparison to the crowds of hundreds of thousands who protested against the former regime.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Rather, what we are witnessing is a well-orchestrated campaign designed to destabilize the country.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If Russia really has genuine concerns about Ukraine's Russian-speaking population, then its actions have done nothing to safeguard their interests.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The illegal annexation of Crimea, stoking tensions and provoking violence in eastern Ukraine, hurt and endanger all the people of Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The special monitoring mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and the United Nations human rights monitoring mission are in Ukraine to observe the situation and report on developments.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Their presence is designed to safeguard the rights of all the citizens of Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We look forward to their assessment of the situation and we fully support their work.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia is seeking to impose its will on the people of Ukraine by using misinformation, intimidation and aggression - tactics drawn from the darkest days of the past century.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is completely unacceptable.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian people have the right to determine their own future free from Russian interference.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 25 May Ukraine will elect a new president.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has stated clearly that its programme of constitutional reform will include discussions on the degree of autonomy devolved to Ukraine's regions.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is a clear pathway to resolve differences through peaceful, constitutional means.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The use of armed force that we are now witnessing in eastern Ukraine to impose one set of views on the peaceful majority is therefore entirely without justification.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Moscow must reject these latest unlawful actions, and do so publicly.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Since yesterday, we have seen the abrupt and simultaneous outbreak of violence in eastern Ukraine: nothing about it was spontaneous.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: France condemns the violence.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on all parties to exercise restraint and dialogue so that a peaceful solution to the crisis quickly emerges.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Everyone must work towards de-escalation.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The scenario we are seeing reminds one of the events that took place in Crimea one month ago: simultaneous action by a small but trained group of aggressive activists determined to occupy territory, followed by the presence of disciplined, masked men wearing uniforms and armed with weapons of war that are not found in military surplus.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those facts, which come to us through the waves of images on the Internet, are the same as the ones that Russia labelled a month ago as spontaneous demonstrations by local self-defence groups.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: No one believed it then, and we do not believe it today.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: One gets the impression that, in denying the facts, Russia is unaware ofthe existence of the Internet and that it serves to contradict its denials.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us not forget that such protests were a prelude to the annexation of Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Moreover, the build-up of Russian troops for several weeks now - under the guise of military exercises - casts an ominous shadow over eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Further still, the economic pressure is becoming more biting.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Without dialogue with the Ukrainian side, which it has taken by the throat, Russia has brutally raised the price of gas.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It blocks the entry of goods at the border between Russia and Ukraine, no doubt in an effort to stifle a country it calls its brother.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Finally, Russia is systematically bombarding Ukraine with a message of defiance vis-a-vis Kyiv via the airwaves and television channels, which, for many people who do not have access to various sources of information, is the only message they hear.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is against that backdrop that France commends the level-headedness of Ukrainian officials who, against that destabilizing torrent of events, seek to resolve the crisis through dialogue.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is the spirit in which Prime Minister Yatsenyuk visited eastern Ukraine with specific proposals in response to the real questions of people overwhelmed by propaganda who are disoriented and being exploited by radical groups.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: France has always been clear on the issue of the status oflanguages and regions.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We encourage the authorities in Kyiv to continue their efforts for cooler heads to prevail, enter into a constructive dialogue and reassure people about their place in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The future of Ukraine should not, and cannot, be up to anyone else but the Ukrainians themselves.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We should support the Ukrainian authorities in organizing elections, under the best of conditions, that ensure that everyone is represented.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our message has always been clear that the presidential election scheduled for 25 May must be free and transparent and guaranteed by the presence of international observers.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We reiterate our commitment to the territorial integrity of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on Russia commit to de-escalation and to condemn, along with the rest of the Council, the attempts at destabilization carried out by armed groups in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also call on Russia to fully assume its role as a permanent member of the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia is a guarantor of peace and security in the world, both in the larger world and in its immediate neighbourhood.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There cannot be two different standards.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia must today put its full weight behind helping Ukraine regain stability.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It must show itself up to the task ofplaying the role it wishes to play as a pillar of Euro-Asian stability.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the proposed meeting on 17 April among Russia, Ukraine, the United States and the European Union will be held and that it makes it possible for solutions to emerge.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is a crucial stage and we call on all parties to exercise calm and restraint.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In conclusion, I would like to raise a final warning call.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The danger that now faces us is the failure of all our concerted efforts to build an international order that is not based on force, for today it is force alone that is seeking to impose the law.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank you, Madam President, for convening this emergency meeting on the situation in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also thank Assistant Secretary-General Oscar Fernandez-Taranco for his briefing on the worrying situation in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are very alarmed by reports of increased tensions in eastern Ukraine in the past several days.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We condemn the attack that killed a State security officer and wounded five others in the eastern city of Slovyansk.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The perpetrators of that criminal act should be brought to justice.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I take this opportunity to echo the Secretary-General's call to all sides to work towards calming the situation.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: After numerous calls for the de-escalation of the crisis, the situation has become more complex for the diverse Ukrainian community.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is imperative to protect the rights of the citizens of Ukraine regardless of ethnic background.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We reiterate our call for an inclusive dialogue, a frank and open discussion that is mutually beneficial for all the parties concerned.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Although Rwanda agrees in principle that Ukraine, like any other country, has a right to self-defence and to promote its territorial integrity, its acts should be proportional.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We discourage any military act that would put the lives of innocent civilians in danger.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Rwanda remains of the View that military action will only worsen the already tense situation.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We encourage all the parties involved, particularly in the current situation, to exercise full restraint.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is vital to allow the diplomatic efforts that have already been deployed to work.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international community cannot watch another crisis slip out of its hands.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We must act on what we stand for - peace and security.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We welcome the discussion among the United States, Ukraine and Russia due to take place on 17 April.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We encourage United Nations participation in those talks.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In conclusion, let me reiterate that the Security Council, the only world body in charge of maintaining international peace and security, must work towards restoring its own unity in order to be able to defend the unity, sovereignty and territorial integrity of a States Members of the United Nations, while addressing the interests of the countries of the region.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We recognize that there are political interests involved.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, we should not forget that ordinary Ukrainians are caught in the midst of this conflict; all they want and ask for is a peaceful country.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This we should all be mindful of.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Like all of us, Australia has watched the events in eastern Ukraine with mounting concern.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What we have seen unfold is a coordinated operation where well-trained and well-armed paramilitary units have moved quickly to lay siege to, occupy and control key institutions in five or six towns in Donetsk province.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The violence in Sloviansk has led to one death and nine wounded.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The stakes are obviously dangerously high.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This has not been a spontaneous, grassroots, broad-based protest movement by local inhabitants; rather it is a pattern of highly orchestrated destabilization by pro-Russian groups.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those groups have included units of highly trained armed men with Russian military equipment, operating without identifying insignia.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those units have used force to storm and besiege local Government buildings and institutions.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If all that sounds familiar, it is because we have seen the playbook used by Russia in Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that case, it became clear that the militias were in fact Russian forces.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We condemn any use ofproxy forces.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A State cannot seek to avoid responsibility for its actions by attempting to cloak the identity of those working on its behalf.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The principles of State responsibility make it very clear that a State bears international responsibility for acts undertaken by informal actors whom it engages on its behalf.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have heard Russia's statement about the crisis taking place in eastern Ukraine, but what we are actually witnessing is Violence and destabilization in an effort to manufacture a sense of crisis and separatism.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine's response to those provocations has been one of restraint under intolerable threats to its stability and independence.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is no evidence of actions directed at Russian speakers in eastern Ukraine that could possibly justify an intervention by Russia.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Nor is there the generalized anarchy claimed.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The ongoing work of the special mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe is all the more important for providing an objective account of the situation in eastern Ukraine, and we welcome the information that the number of monitors will be significantly increased in coming days.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: International condemnation of Russia's actions against Ukraine in the past six weeks has been resounding.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: General Assembly resolution 68/262 unambiguously condemned the threat and use of force in this manner as contrary to the Charter of the United Nations and to Russia's specific treaty obligations to Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Many countries, including my own, have imposed unilateral sanctions to register the depth of their concern.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Repeated calls for de-escalation have been ignored.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia's major military build-up along Ukraine's eastern border has been a significant and deliberation provocation that only further escalates tensions and the likelihood of conflict.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It deepens Russia's own isolation and also, of course, strengthens the resolve of the international community to stand with and support Ukraine as it seeks to maintain its sovereignty and territorial integrity.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The only way forward, as we all know, is de-escalation, dialogue and the free elections that are planned for 25 May.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And Ukraine must be allowed to prepare for those elections without the interference and coercion we are witnessing.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But talks can take place only with genuine commitment and good faith on all sides.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The talks between Russia, Ukraine, the European Union and the United States planned for 17 April are an essential step in that direction, but can take place successfully only on that basis.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Attempts to change the facts on the ground are completely contrary to dialogue and peaceful resolution.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on Russia to work immediately to reduce tensions, stop its destabilization and withdraw its forces from the provocative posture they have assumed on Ukraine's border.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have heard assurances in the past that Russia will take such action.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It now really is imperative that it do so.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank Assistant Secretary-General Fernandez-Taranco for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China is deeply worried about the recent escalation of the situation in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the relevant parties will remain calm, exercise restraint and avoid any further deterioration of the situation.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Settling the question of Ukraine involves the interests and concerns of all parties.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It should be considered in a balanced manner.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Political and diplomatic channels should continue to be pursued in order to narrow differences and settle the issue within the framework of law and order.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China has consistently called on the international community to make constructive efforts and employ good offices to ease the situation in Ukraine, and will continue to support the international community in those endeavours.
speaker: Mr. Wang Min
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I, too, would like to thank Assistant Secretary-General for Political Affairs Oscar Fernandez-Taranco for his briefing on the developments in Ukraine and on the involvement of the United Nations.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also welcome the presence of the Permanent Representative of Ukraine at this meeting.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Argentina continues to follow the situation with concern, in particular in the east of Ukraine.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Undoubtedly, the situation has deteriorated, with further tensions and violence, and we cannot remain indifferent to that.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are deeply concerned that the tension and violence may continue and indeed worsen.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are also concerned about the consequences for Ukraine and the region.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The delegation of Argentina reiterates that it is essential that we adhere to the principles that we subscribe to as Members of the United Nations.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In particular, we must remember our commitment to non-interference in the internal affairs of States, whether militarily, politically or economically.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that respect, we believe that the action of any State or international organization must duly respect Ukraine's handling of its own affairs.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As we have expressed on several occasions, the situation will not be resolved through any kind of unilateral action.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is crucial that the use of force be avoided.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We join the Secretary-General today in calling on all parties to endeavour to bring calm to the situation.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Maximal self-restraint must be shown, and constructive dialogue sought and established on an urgent basis in order to de-escalate the situation and address the parties' differences.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In conclusion, Argentina will continue to promote dialogue and a peaceful settlement of the crisis.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is essential to step up efforts to create the conditions necessary for urgent dialogue to begin so that solutions can be found to the parties' differences and the interests of all minorities are taken into account.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The multilateral meeting among the United States, the Russian Federation and the European Union that is planned for Thursday, 17 April will present an opportunity to do so.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that those main actors will be able to achieve the agreement necessary.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We reiterate that the international community should concentrate its efforts on establishing dialogue.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We stress that Ukrainians must have a democratic and peaceful outcome to the situation.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ithank Assistant Secretary-General Oscar Fernandez-Taranco for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Republic of Korea is closely watching the recent developments in the eastern part of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are deeply concerned over the escalation of tensions in various cities of eastern Ukraine, including the worrying seizure of key public buildings in Donetsk and Slovyansk by force.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those actions will only further exacerbate the already tense situation, and we condemn any use of force to change the situation on the ground.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As Ukraine moves towards critical elections in May, we believe that political differences must be addressed in a non-violent way through a legitimate process.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: United Nations States Members should respect that process, and there should not be any influence exerted by outside forces.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We reiterate our strong support for the sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We would like to thank Assistant Secretary-General Oscar Fernandez-Taranco for his briefing and welcome the convening of this meeting at this critical time for Ukraine and the region.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We face a sensitive development in the crisis in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Chile regrets the outbreaks of violence seen in the eastern regions, specifically in Donetsk, Luhansk and Kharkiv, and expresses its deep concern over the serious consequences of the escalation of the crisis owing to the actions of separatist groups.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is critical that the parties exercise the maximum restraint in order to contain the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our country once again reiterates the need to respect the sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also reaffirm the obligation incumbent on Members of the United Nations to refrain from resorting to the threat of or use of force against the territorial integrity and political independence of any State.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is urgent that all parties involved refrain from undertaking actions that are contrary to the provisions of the Charter of the United Nations and the international agreements and treaties to which Ukraine is a party.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We once again call on the parties to seek a peaceful solution to the crisis through direct political dialogue, to refrain from taking unilateral measures and to support international mediation initiatives, in accordance with General Assembly resolution 68/262.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That process must be inclusive and must ensure the rule of law, human rights, fundamental freedoms and full respect for the rights of minorities.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that context, the role of the Security Council, the Secretary-General, his Special Envoy and regional organizations continues to be fundamental.
speaker: Mr. Llanos
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank you, Madam President, for this opportunity to speak before the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank Council members for understanding the critical situation in Ukraine and for their support.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Before getting into the substance of my statement this evening, I would like start by mentioning that today Christians worldwide celebrate a great holiday, the day of the entry of our Lord into Jerusalem, Palm Sunday.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, today the celebration is falling under the shadow of aggression and bloodshed in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the eve of the holiday, terrorists coordinated by agents of the Russian Federation seized control of State buildings in several cities of the Donetsk region.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let me quote a statement made today by Ukraine's acting President Oleksandr Turchynov: "A particularly dangerous situation has arisen in the city of Slavyansk, where professionally trained armed troops wearing Russian armed forces camouflage without insignia shattered the peace.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This morning, a convoy of law enforcement officers who sought to protect the citizens of Slavyansk were attacked with assault rifles.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The criminals opened intense fire using local people as human shields.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The blood of Ukrainians has been shed for one undivided sovereign Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That blood has been shed in a war that Russia is waging against Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The aggressor has not stopped, and continues to organize unrest in the eastern regions of our country.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is not a war between Ukrainians.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The situation of confrontation was artificially created with the aim of weakening and destroying Ukraine itself."
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Within a short period of time, approximately one and half months, the Ukrainian Government has done everything possible to avoid confrontation through an inclusive approach to each and every region.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Recently, Mr. Yatsenyuk, the Prime Minister of Ukraine, visited the southern and eastern regions - Donetsk, Lugansk, Kharkiv, Dnepropetrovsk, Odessa * addressing such issues of concern as the language policy and prospects for decentralization of power and constitutional reforms.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Government is ready to consider the significant empowerment of local authorities in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, the efforts of the Government of Ukraine have been severely challenged by recent developments in the eastern regions.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: According to Ukrainian intelligence data, during the past month and a half in the eastern regions of Ukraine, agents of the Russian special services embarked on large-scale operations to seize power and destabilize the situation, threatening the lives of citizens of Ukraine, for the purpose of separating those regions from our country.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: During the past month, our Mission has regularly informed the Security Council and all States Members of the United Nations on the latest developments in Russian actions in Crimea and other regions of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia has not only been constantly increasing the number of its troops deployed along the Ukrainian border but it has also been sending subversive groups into Ukrainian regions in order to destabilize the situation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Such specially designated groups, made up of 10 to 20 members of the special forces, primarily from the main intelligence directorate or general staff of the armed forces of the Russian Federation, infiltrated Ukrainian territory with the task of forming and organizing military combat units.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine has strong evidence of the involvement of the Russian special service forces, as was mentioned in a statement the Minister for Foreign Affairs of Ukraine made public early today.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The detention of Russian citizen members of subversive groups coordinated by the Russian federal security services and military intelligence is carried out on a daily basis by the security services of Ukraine, yielding the following facts, which are just a few out of dozens.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 8 April, Russian citizen Maria Koleda, who fulfilled intelligence service tasks to destabilize in eastern Ukraine, was detained in Herson.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Russian saboteur who was about to seize such strategic facilities as the Kakhovka hydroelectric power plant was detained in the region of Herson.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 10 March, a representative of the Russian Federation military intelligence service was detained in Donetsk.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 12 March, the intelligence group of the Russian armed forces that infiltrated the Herson territory from Crimea was detained at the control point.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 20 March, a Russian citizen named Markhov, an officer of the main intelligence directorate of the general staff of Russian Federation armed forces, was detained in Chernigiv.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the same day, a Russian citizen named Oleg Bakhtiar, one of the leaders of the Eurasian Youth Union of Russia, was detained in Kyiv as he was preparing a group of people under the guise of civil activities for the criminal seizure of the Verkhovna Rada and the Cabinet of Ministers.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All of the arrestees confirmed being part of a network of persons conducting Russian subversive activities in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Intercepted radio communications of the aforementioned groups, and others, with their Russian coordinators are available and provide other clear evidence.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has also been observed that such terrorist groups are heavily armed with weapons used exclusively by Russian armed forces, namely, the Kalashnikov assault rifle AK-lOO series.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those weapons have also been seen in the hands of Russian troops in Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is clear that the tactics used by terrorists to capture admininstrative buildings in the regions of Donetsk, Lugansk and Kharkiv are identical to those used to seize the buildings of the Crimean Parliament and other Governmental building in Crimea, which video evidence confirms.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Terrorist groups are acting in a very organized and pre-planned manner.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: One of the goals is to equip as many locally recruited marginal people as possible with arms and ammunition.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is why the primary targets of terrorists have been local offices of police and security services with weapon storage facilities.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As a result, several hundred guns and automatic rifles have been seized are now in the hands of terrorists.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is substantial video evidence of armed attacks using gunfire on local Ukrainian police stations, in Slavyansk and Kramatorsk in particular.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those videos, which have been widely broadcast on international television channels and over the Internet, have left absolutely no doubt that the terrorist groups are not the peaceful protesters that our Russian colleagues claim them to be.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Rather, they are professional special forces appropriately equipped and armed by the Russian Federation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Terrorists have started using their weapons against Ukrainian law enforcement and military officers.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This morning in Slavyansk the auto convoy of the Ukrainian military was attacked by gunmen using automatic weapons.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Terrorists shot and killed Captain Gennady Belichenko of the Ukrainian security services, while "Alfa" Commander Kuznietsov and Colonel Kuksa were seriously wounded, as was a police officer named Selikhov.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the light of the aforementioned facts, the National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine, pursuant to our anti-terrorism law of 2003, has adopted a decision to launch a large-scale counter-terrorist operation involving the special units of the Ukrainian armed forces.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are not going to let the Crimea scenario be repeated in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have not imposed a state of emergency as is required by the provisions of the Constitution of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Instead, we have prepared a counterinsurgency plan to strike at the armed terrorists.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In his statement today, acting President Oleksandr Turchynov said, "I would like to emphasize that those not involved in shooting at Ukrainian law enforcement officers and who surrender their weapons and leave seized administrative buildings will not be subject to prosecution."
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Only a few weeks have passed since part of the territory of Ukraine was annexed by the Russian Federation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And now Russia is applying the same tools - inciting separatists by waging unprecedented anti-Ukrainian propaganda in the mass media, distorting the truth about Ukraine, sending in special troops to seize administrative and law-enforcement buildings with the aim of destabilizing the situation in the eastern regions of Ukraine, and encouraging marginal groups to pursue their separatist ambitions, threatening my country's unity and territorial integrity.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Apparently, through these attempts, they hope to disrupt the presidential elections in Ukraine scheduled for 25 May.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia often positions itself as a prominent fighter against international terrorism, but by sending its special agents to Ukraine to effect diversions and sabotage, it is actually sponsoring terrorism.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia's statements and position are in fact supporting the terrorists in Ukraine who have seized administrative buildings, taken over the military arsenals of the Ukrainian secret services and police in several cities and opened fire on Ukrainian police.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today, official Russian TV channels have widely broadcast interviews with the three individuals - former President Yanukovych, former Prosecutor General Pshonka and former Minister of the Interior Zakharchenko - who are suspected mass murderers in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are wanted internationally.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine has repeatedly asked its Russian partners to extradite those suspects and provide the necessary assistance for their investigation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, the Russian Federation has refused to do that.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine is being subjected to a large-scale terrorist operation orchestrated by the Russian Federation in subregions of the eastern part of the country.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That constitutes a serious threat not only to the security of the people of Ukraine but to international peace and stability as a whole.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We consider it to be the Security Council's duty to find a proper and peaceful solution to this crisis.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We once again call on our Russian partners to put an immediate halt to the actions aimed at undermining the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We demand that they leave us in peace.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: (spoke in French)
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As Ambassador Araud said, this is truly a final cry of warning.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Many words have been spoken and many pronouncements made here today.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But the first impression I would like to share with my colleagues is that they have not been looking at the clock.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is now 9.30 pm.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: our time, which means that in Ukraine it is about 3.30 am.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That means that in a couple of hours it will be Monday morning, 14 April.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is the date when it has been agreed that Mr. Turchynov's criminal decree sending Ukraine's military forces to suppress the protests will take effect.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have heard many unfair pronouncements about Russia today, but of course the most unfair of all came from our Ukrainian colleague, who accused Russia of terrorism.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why did he not accuse those who terrorized his Government for months on end, up to 21 February, of terrorism?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They were people who really did terrorize the forces of law and order, who really did attack police and shoot at them and at those protesting against the authorities and seemed to be attacking their country.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why were they not called terrorists?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indeed, they have been exempted from any responsibility for the criminal activities they conducted for several months.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I reiterate that, unfortunately, several clumsy accusations have been made against Russia.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has been said that Russia somehow wishes to destabilize Ukraine, if not practically crush it altogether.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But why was there no response to our call at the start of the crisis for launching a dialogue on how to help Ukraine emerge from the political and economic crisis it had found itself in?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why was the crisis encouraged to continue?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why was it only just a few days ago that the Foreign Ministers of France, Germany and Poland said that the European Union and Russia should indeed talk about the economic prospects for Ukraine, Georgia and Moldova in connection with their joining the partnership programme of the European Union.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And, by the way, we have heard nothing about the fact that those ministerial conversations took place in Brussels.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us see what the response will be to the reproaches to Russia over the fact that we do not want supply Ukraine with gas for free.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us see on 14 April what response the European ministers will give to the letter that President Putin wrote proposing that we work together to help Ukraine emerge from its economic turmoil.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is true that the people in Washington, DC, to whom we did not send the letter, have already poisoned it for the European Union, calling it economic blackmail.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But let us see whether the European Union has retained some kind of sovereignty and whether it is capable of making independent, rational decisions that can help to rescue the situation from crisis.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: During the entire course of the crisis in Ukraine, Russia has never advocated aggravating it or destabilizing the country.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have absolutely no interest in doing such a thing, since for us Ukraine is too important as an economic and political partner and a country that is very close to us in many ways.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We do not desire its destabilization.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are not to blame for what has produced the results that we are now witnessing.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Mr. Fernandez-Taranco said that it was on 6 April that the actions were first observed whereby residents of south-eastern areas of Ukraine were seizing certain administrative buildings.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And in this, of course, they learned from the experience of the Maidan in Kyiv, where for weeks and months administrative buildings were occupied, and which for some reason our Western partners saw as demonstrations of democracy.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But when it came to the south-eastern regions of Ukraine, somehow such tactics were unacceptable.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A month and a half elapsed between 21 February and 6 April; a month and a half had gone by since the overthrow of President Yanukovych and the conclusion of the agreement that could have prevented an escalation of the situation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: From the very beginning, all we said was that it was essential to conclude that agreement; that perhaps a constitutional assembly should be convoked; and that some decisive gesture should be made towards the south-eastern regions of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Was any such gesture made?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Finally, Mr. Yatsenyuk came, said something and left.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Then Mr. Turchynov came the next day and did not seem to agree with him.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It seemed they preferred to use force.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Incidentally, some very worrying tones have crept into our numerous contacts with our Western colleagues.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As the Council knows, our Minister for Foreign Affairs, Mr. Sergei Lavrov, has been talking to Secretary of State Kerry on the phone almost every day.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Kerry continually claims to understand our concern that in contacts with the Ukrainian authorities genuine efforts should be made to ensure that they demonstrate a better grasp of the concerns of the south-eastern regions of Ukraine regarding a definition of their autonomy, independence and language rights.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And then suddenly one ofthe United States Deputy Secretaries of State gets up in Congress and says, we know that these talks will not lead anywhere, but we have to occupy the time somehow.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: "Occupy the time."
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: So, really, maybe somebody in Washington, DC, is thinking about Turchynov's military offensive scenario.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In which case, there is no need to accuse Russia of attempting destabilization.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The representative of the United States noted that Vice-President Biden will be going to Ukraine, it seems, on 21 April.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But maybe he should not wait for 21 April.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Maybe he should go right now.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Pick up the phone, call Mr. Turchynov - as he called President Yanukovych more than once before 21 February - and say to him what he said to Mr. Yanukovych.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As we were informed by the Vice-President's Chief of Staff, he said, "For God's sake, just do not use force.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Call off your forces from the centre of Kyiv".
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That was what Mr. Biden said.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And now, is the United States going to encourage the fulfilment of this criminal decree authorizing the use of military force?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why, in one case, when it was a question of preparations to storm the residence of the President of Ukraine, the call was that under no circumstances should force be used, while in the current situation, it is to encourage the insane military actions that Turchynov's decree talks about?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would therefore request Ms. Power to ask Vice-President Biden to call Mr. Turchynov right now, because in a few hours' time things might take an irreversible turn.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Many colleagues mentioned the meeting that was announced for 17 April.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indeed, for some months now, in particular during the period after 21 February, we have constantly encouraged such formats for dialogue as a possible way to achieve a solution to the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We agreed in principle that the meeting would take place among the Minister for Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, Secretary of State Kerry, Ms. Ashton and the Minister for Foreign Affairs of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We very much hope that such a high-level meeting will encourage a broad political dialogue in Ukraine and show the way towards a political solution to the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But what does the Council think?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If armed force is used and hostilities take place tomorrow, are we really going to sign off on that meeting?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Of course, that initiative is going to be fundamentally undermined if military operations are commenced in south-eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Please, let us refrain from any accusations or speculation as to why Russia is trying to do what it is doing.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us focus our attention on what we can actually do in this case.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Here I am speaking to my Western colleagues.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us ensure that we do not permit the Ukrainian authorities to commit the reckless actions that are currently enshrined in the criminal decree by Mr. Turchynov, and let us stop that decree from being implemented.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That would have extremely significant consequences, first and foremost for the people of Ukraine, of course.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That needs to be avoided.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I will be brief, but in response to my colleague from the Russian Federation, I would like to say just a few things.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: First, the United States has constantly called for de-escalation and urged restraint.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That has been our consistent policy.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our consistent statements have made clear that military force is not the answer, and we have commended the Ukrainians, frankly, for enduring more than probably any country in the United Nations could or would endure without using force.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Therefore, there have been no shortage of efforts at diplomacy.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Secondly, it is not the United States that has escalated the situation, it is the Russian Federation.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Thirdly, while we would like to place our faith in talks with the Russian Federation, the European Union and Ukraine, it is hard to reconcile the behaviour of the Russian Federation, the propaganda of the Russian Federation and the military actions of the Russian Federation - which range from the massing of 40,000 troops on the border to the subversive activities inside Ukraine - with their appeal for diplomacy and de-escalation.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is an appeal that we wish were in fact sincere.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Fourthly, a few times, the representative of the Russian Federation has described what is happening in the eastern cities as protests and demonstrations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would refer back to my French colleague's comment that those claims are rooted in some idea that the Internet does not exist and that people cannot see for themselves that they are not protests and they are not demonstrations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are professional forces carrying weapons - Russian-made weapons, as it happens - and carrying out sophisticated, coordinated military operations across a substantial number of eastern Ukrainian cities.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are not demonstrations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are not protests.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are military operations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Finally, the credibility of the Russian Federation has been gravely undermined.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That said, we remain eager and willing to talk about how to de-escalate the situation.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That will require that the Russian Federation pull back its forces, which are ominously stationed and massed at the eastern Ukrainian border.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It will require that the Russian Federation work to de-escalate the situation in the light of the armed takeover of those buildings.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If, in fact, the Russian Federation is interested in peace and in upholding its role as an enforcer of international peace and security, then it will engage quickly and with a wholly different degree of conviction, urgency and truthfulness than it has up to this point.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Several issues were raised by our Russian colleague.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text:
I would like to answer just one.
(spoke in Russian)
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: First, Mr. Churkin compared the situation in December and January with the current situation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We must recall that, at that time, the people were speaking out against the banditry of the authorities, and now it is bandits who are against the people.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is a difference there.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We cannot remain calm about the fact that several hundred separatists are holding thousands of people hostage to fear in towns.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We see the standoffs on television in Kharkiv, Luhansk and Dnipropetrovsk.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We cannot look on while small groups of armed people, headed up, inter alia, by agents from the Russian Federation, seize State buildings and take weapons to hand out.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indeed, those are terrorist operations that have been specially organized and orchestrated.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Mr. Churkin is absolutely right, there is not much time left at all, there is just about an hour and a half.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is just as easy for him to call his President and say a few simple things to him as it is for me to do so, so I will repeat them here.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The statement that Mr. Churkin has referred very negatively to several times today was made by the acting President, Mr. Turchynov, and was addressed to those people who are now creating tension in those towns, the terrorist groups of separatists.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He stated: (spoke in English) "Those not involved in shooting at Ukrainian law enforcement officers and who will surrender their weapons and leave State administrative buildings will be released from prosecution."
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: (spoke in Russian)
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why do they not call their people and tell them to come back, sit down around the negotiating table and decide together how we can establish good neighbourly relations?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That would be the right thing to do.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Government mentioned the referendum, changes to the Constitution, the retention of the language law and the fact that the problems that have cropped up over the decades and remained unsolved by previous Governments needed to be addressed at last.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is something that we need to do, but we are being prevented from doing so.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like Mr. Churkin to listen to that and convey what he can to his Government.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: (spoke in English)
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am sincerely thankful to the members of the Security Council who spoke in favour of a peaceful resolution of the problems in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am sincerely thankful for that.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also thank the members of the Security Council for understanding the critical situation in Ukraine and for any kind of support they can provide.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I shall not take up much ofthe Council's time.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I should just like to say two things.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: First, the representative of Ukraine is far too easy in characterizing his own people as bandits.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Right Sector and those who say the demonstrators should be killed are not bandits; they are simply the political elite of Kyiv.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Are not those who are protesting in eastern Ukraine able to do so without Russia's say-so?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Do they need Russia to say that events in Kyiv are unacceptable before they are able to grasp that?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: When radicals come to tell the miners of that region that they will establish their own order - surely the miners can understand that without a hint from Russia?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Are the protesters able to understand how bad things have become only when Russian agents come to explain the situation to them?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Do their own life experience and understanding of the situation in their own country count for nothing?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: How will those things influence them?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Secondly, with regard to the statement made by my American colleague Ms. Power, she did not mention her view on the decree to use armed force in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I hope that, as the Ukrainian representative has called for, following today's discussion some Western colleagues and partners will pick up the telephone and call their leaders and those in Kyiv with whom they enjoy influence, who may not act unless they get the green light from Western capitals.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would ask my colleagues to give them the red light and tell them that problems can be resolved through dialogue and not military confrontation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am grateful to Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom requested this meeting because we are deeply concerned by the deteriorating security situation in southern and eastern Ukraine and by the fact that the Geneva agreement of 17 April is not yet achieving its objective to restore stability in Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is vitally important that the Security Council maintain its close scrutiny of events in Ukraine and the consequent threat to international peace and security.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine
