sentence_text: We will doubtless hear Russian claims that it is the actions of the Ukrainian Government that are destabilizing the south and east of the country.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In fact, it is Russia that has taken further dangerous steps aimed at fomenting instability in Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has directed paramilitary actions in Sloviansk, Kramatorsk, Lugansk and other towns in eastern Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian military jets and helicopters have made incursions into Ukrainian airspace.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian armed forces have held further military exercises on Ukraine's border.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These are all clear attempts to escalate tensions within Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These steps have been matched with intensified rhetoric.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation has asserted that Russia has a legal basis to intervene in Ukraine in accordance with the right of self-defence under Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is a claim that takes Russia's distortion of international law to a new level.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is no justification or legal basis whatsoever for invoking Article 51.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian nationals are not under threat in Ukraine - a fact that has been reaffirmed on numerous occasions, including by the United Nations Human Rights Monitoring Mission and by the Commissioner for National Minorities of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is deeply irresponsible rhetoric intended to threaten and intimidate the Ukrainian Government and provide a bogus pretext for further illegal breaches of Ukrainian sovereignty and territorial integrity.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As a result of Russia's activities, there has been a further marked deterioration in the security situation in eastern and southern Ukraine, as Mr. Feltman has just said.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom condemns the abduction at gunpoint and public parading of an OSCE Vienna Document inspection team and its Ukrainian escorts.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call upon those responsible to ensure the safe treatment and immediate release of the team, and we urge Russia, itselfan OSCE member, to use its influence to ensure that this happens without further delay.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 17 April, talks between Ukraine, Russia, the United States and the European Union succeeded in agreeing steps to reduce tensions.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom welcomed that agreement and the opportunity it offered for restoring stability in Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But this opportunity has been spurned.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Since 17 April, the actions undertaken by Kyiv and Moscow stand in stark contrast.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us consider the facts.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: First, the Geneva agreement called for all sides to refrain from violence, intimidation and provocative actions.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: For its part, the Ukrainian Government has acted with commendable restraint when undertaking measured and proportionate security operations to deal with armed groups illegally occupying Government buildings and forming checkpoints.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has the right and responsibility to uphold the rule of law and protect both its citizens and its officials on Ukrainian territory.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia, on the other hand, continues its military manoeuvres and aggressive rhetoric.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Secondly, the agreement called for all illegal armed groups to be disarmed.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government started to collect illegal weapons almost as soon as it came to power.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There are now no illegally armed protesters on Maidan Square and no armed self-defence groups patrolling the streets of Kyiv.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But in Sloviansk and other eastern cities, we continue to see, encouraged by Russia, heavily armed paramilitary forces armed with automatic rifles and rocket-propelled grenades.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Thirdly, the agreement called for all illegally seized buildings, occupied streets and public places to be vacated.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has been systematically and incrementally removing barricades around the Maidan and the protests there are gradually shrinking.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: By contrast, Russia has refused to use its influence to restrain armed groups in the east.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In fact, Foreign Minister Lavrov stated on 23 April that Russia will not call for these illegal militias to put down their arms and vacate buildings.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Instead, barricades and roadblocks in eastern and southern Ukraine have been steadily reinforced.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Furthermore, while Ukraine has put a draft law to the Ukrainian Parliament that would provide amnesty for protestors who vacate Government buildings and lay down their weapons, Russia has not rescinded the order by the Russian Parliament to authorize the use of military force in Ukraine and will not condemn the widely reported abuses by pro-Russian armed groups in southern and eastern Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These abuses include at least 11 kidnappings, among them several Ukrainian and international journalists, and the torture and murder ofa Ukrainian local official and two other local people.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The deplorable shooting yesterday of the Mayor of Kharkiv was another sign of the violence being instigated against those who have opted to support a united Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Finally, Ukraine has begun an inclusive process of constitutional reform on the decentralization of power.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has announced measures to guarantee the protection of the Russian language, and it has condemned instances of anti-Semitism and xenophobia, whereas Russian rhetoric continues to whip up tensions with false claims that the Russian language is under threat in Ukraine and allegations that the Kyiv Government is anti-Semitic.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: When one lays out the facts, they cut through the fiction of Russian propaganda.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Having illegally annexed Crimea, Russia is now destabilizing southern and eastern Ukraine as part of its plan to undermine the ability of the people of Ukraine to determine peacefully their own future.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In doing so, it is threatening international peace and security.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But the doors of diplomacy remain open.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge Russia to abandon the dangerous course it is pursuing and to take urgent steps to implement the Geneva agreement.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the extremely difficult circumstances which now confront it, the Ukrainian Government is striving to take forward a programme of democratization and inclusive constitutional and economic reform that aims to correct the long period of misgovernment and corruption that preceded it.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is in all our interests to support this process.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is not about zero-sum game politics; it is about restoring stability to Ukraine and to the wider region and allowing all the people of Ukraine to determine their own future.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge Russia to become part of this collective international effort.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank Mr. Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Since early April, the situation in Ukraine has deteriorated continuously.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In several eastern cities, armed militants, acting in a professional and synchronized manner, have taken possession of public buildings.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The similarity of the operations that were observed in Crimea is striking.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The violence continues.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Seven observers of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) were taken hostage on 25 April.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They must be released without delay.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On Sunday, the mayor of Kharkiv was the target of an attack and is in a serious condition.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are witnessing a a subversive operation that has been planned, barely disguised and orchestrated by Russia.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian special forces do not even hide anymore.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Some time ago, our Russian colleague denied their involvement in Crimea, while his President recognized it a few days later.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: No doubt, he will do the same with respect to current events in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: France strongly and unequivocally condemns those unacceptable attempts by Russia to destabilize Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We must halt this course of confrontation and work towards de-escalation.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The joint declaration agreed on in Geneva on 17 April by Ukraine, Russia, the United States and the European Union shows the way forward.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It calls on all parties to refrain from violence and acts of intimidation or provocation.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It provides for the disarmament of illegal armed groups, evacuation of occupied buildings and public places and amnesty for those who lay down their arms, with the exception of individuals with blood on their hands.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is essential that the declaration be implemented by all parties without delay and in good faith, so that the Ukrainian State can re-establish its sovereignty over its territory.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The OSCE's special monitoring mission has been asked to play an important role in implementing those de-escalation measures, and it is essential that it be allowed to act without hindrance.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, since the declaration's adoption we have seen two distinct attitudes.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the one hand, the Ukrainian Government has shown its good faith in implementing the declaration by drafting an amnesty law, launching the process of constitutional reform and accelerating the dismantling of barricades and armed groups in Kyiv.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, I commend the restraint and composure of the Ukrainian security forces, who have responded appropriately to the repeated destabilizing actions they are dealing with.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We can only imagine what any other Government would have done in the face of such provocation on its national territory.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the other hand, the Russian side has complied with none of the 17 April commitments.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There has been no condemnation of the separatist actions that have spawned new violence and no call for public buildings to be evacuated.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There has been no appeal to the pro-Russian militants to exercise restraint and end their attacks on munitions depots and on their compatriots, some of whom are said to have been tortured, and on journalists as well.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Far from condemning those who took the OSCE observers hostage, today Russia is calling the mission's presence in eastern Ukraine a provocation.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, we sincerely hope that the announcement yesterday of a halt to the Russian military manoeuvres on the Ukrainian border is true and will be the first step in a genuine de-escalation.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are at a turning point.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With every moment that passes, the risk of anarchy and bloody incidents grows.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is why we call on the Russian authorities to choose the path of de-escalation through the immediate demonstration of respect for the commitments made in the Geneva declaration.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday, together with our European Union partners and the United States, we adopted new targeted sanctions.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If the situation worsens, we will be forced to ratchet up the sanctions once again.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is not what we would prefer.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our goal is to ensure the holding on 25 May of free, inclusive and transparent presidential elections, whose good conduct will be guaranteed by the presence of international observers.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The possibility that the actions of some violent groups could threaten the holding of this democratic exercise is unacceptable.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also support constitutional reform that would ensure respect for minorities and some decentralization.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is up to all Ukrainians to decide their future.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Then history and geography can bring about an inevitable and desirable reconciliation between a democratic, peaceful and independent Ukraine and a Russian Federation that will renounce its dangerous nationalist illusions.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank you, Madam President, for convening this emergency meeting on Ukraine, and Mr. Jeffrey Feltman, Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs, for his briefing on the developments in the situation in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We believe, however, that the Ukrainian people and the international community will not judge us on the number of public briefings we organize in the Council or the toughness of our statements, but on our political will and how we use our influence to effectively help Ukrainians resolve the crisis in their country.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are witnessing a situation that is deteriorating every day and leading slowly to an open war that might involve countries of the region and beyond.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indeed, the developments of the last few weeks are alarming and have immensely undermined the diplomatic efforts to defuse the situation.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We condemn in the strongest terms the attempt made to assassinate Hennadiy Kernes, the Mayor of Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, as well as the illegal detention of the military monitors from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) and their Ukrainian staff, which is a serious violation of the current agreement, and we demand their immediate release.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: While we welcome the joint de-escalation measures agreed on in Geneva on 17 April and involving the main stakeholders as a step towards a tangible solution to the crisis, we are concerned about the fact that many of those measures have not been implemented.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge all parties to implement their parts of the agreement, and especially to disarm all military groups and restore all seized buildings.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The OSCE monitors must be allowed to play a role and to fulfil their mandate, as stipulated in the joint declaration.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the meantime, Rwanda reiterates its call for respect for Ukraine's independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We believe in the right to peaceful demonstration, but we firmly condemn the use of violence, the seizure of public buildings and the installation of illegal checkpoints by armed protesters.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We therefore believe that Ukraine, like any other country, has a right to restore public order, provided that right is exercised in a proportionate manner.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Nonetheless, the crisis in eastern Ukraine is not merely a matter of public order but a political issue that must be resolved through genuine dialogue with all Ukrainian parties, with a view to ensuring sustainable peace and equal rights for all, including the Russian-speaking minority.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To conclude, we reiterate our strong belief that while public meetings of the Council are important for its members to continue monitoring this crisis, the only way to solve the crisis in Ukraine is through the exercise of political will and the influence of all the countries and regional organizations involved, in order to ensure a political and diplomatic solution to the conflict.
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank Mr. Feltman for his update on the difficult situation in Ukraine.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am wondering, and I would also like to ask the Council, why we are having this meeting.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Going over the difficult situation and the worsening of the crisis once again is undoubtedly one reason, although I know there are clear, decisive reasons behind the initiative of the United Kingdom to convene this meeting that brings us all together.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also ask myself another question, not out of false piety but out of sincerity.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is the question Pope Francis asked a few days ago when he received Mr. Yatsenyuk - who has not sped up hatred and violence - and gave him a pen with which he might sign a peace.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Are we acting in the Council to help overcome misunderstandings?
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am certain that we are.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is for that reason that today my country will merely reaffirm two convictions.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is, that in the dialogue of constructive diplomacy that was initiated on 17 April with a view to finding a peaceful and political solution to this critical situation, Russia, the United States, the European Union and Ukraine all expressed at Geneva a willingness to reach an agreement.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What we saw as willingness to agree, the whole world saw as a source of hope.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today, however, we must urge the parties to return to a constructive dialogue.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The difficult situation facing Ukraine cannot be resolved through unilateral actions of any sort.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is essential that we strictly abide by the principles of the Charter of the United Nations and not intervene in matters under the domestic jurisdiction of States in any way, including military, political and economic.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have already said that, and we have not come here to repeat things.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have come to say that it is understandable that the Council is meeting today.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The other reason we are here is to reject violence involving two concrete events, namely, the attack against the Mayor of Kharkiv, in eastern Ukraine, and, as requested by the Secretary-General, Argentina calls for the immediate and unconditional release of the military observers of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe who are being held hostage.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Again we reiterate that the Council meets in order to promote peace.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With a pen in hand and with our good faith, we stand ready to help Ukraine emerge from this difficult situation so that it can achieve the peace that its people deserve.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 17 April, Ukraine, the Russian Federation, the European Union and the United States issued the Geneva joint statement to de-escalate the crisis that brings us together this evening.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That statement outlined a series of concrete steps to end the violence, halt provocative actions and protect the rights and security of all Ukrainian citizens.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As Secretary Kerry said on 17 April, "All of this, we are convinced, represents a good day's work.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The day's work has produced principles and it has produced commitments and it has produced words on paper.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And we are the first to understand and to agree that words on paper will only mean what the actions that are taken as a result of those words produce."
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Secretary Kerry also commended Foreign Minister Lavrov and the Ukrainian Foreign Minister for their cooperation in achieving that hard-negotiated agreement.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It was a moment of hope.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Since then, the Government of Ukraine has been implementing its commitments in good faith.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Regrettably, the same cannot be said of the Russian Federation.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As we meet, observers from the special monitoring mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) are reporting that most of Ukraine, including eastern Ukraine, is peaceful.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The exceptions are in such areas as Donetsk, Luhansk and Sloviansk, where pro-Russian separatists continue to occupy buildings and attack local officials.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There we have seen a sharp deterioration in law and order.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Just today, pro-Russian separatists armed with baseball bats, stormed the Government buildings in Luhansk, seizing control of the centre of municipal activity in one of the largest cities in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That kind of thuggery mimics the seizures of police stations, city halls and other Government buildings in cities and towns in Donetsk oblast and surrounding areas.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In addition to occupying Government buildings, over the past two weeks, gunmen kidnapped a senior police officer in Luhansk.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In Donetsk, pro-Russian thugs armed with baseball bats attacked peaceful participants at a pro-unity rally, seriously injuring at least 15.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Also in Donetsk, pro-Russian groups continue to hold 17 buildings, including the regional television broadcasting centre.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the city of Sloviansk, the mayor was kidnapped, as were several journalists.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The separatists in that area now hold an estimated 40 hostages.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Nearby, three bodies were recently pulled from a river, each showing unmistakable signs of physical abuse; one has been identified as a local politician, another as a 19 year-old pro-unity student activist.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday, gunmen reportedly chased members of the Sloviansk Roma community from their homes.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Make no mistake: those are not peaceful protests.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is not an eastern Ukrainian spring.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is a well-orchestrated campaign, with external support, to destabilize the Ukrainian State.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Finally, as all the world knows, pro-Russian separatists in Donetsk have kidnapped and continue to hold seven international inspectors, openly declared as members of a Vienna document mission, along with their Ukrainian escorts.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My Government joins with responsible Governments everywhere in condemning that unlawful act and in being outraged by the shameful exhibition before the media of those international public servants.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Vienna document, agreed upon by all 57 participating States of the OSCE, has been a lasting source of cooperation and military transparency.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call, with others, for the immediate and unconditional release of the inspectors and their Ukrainian escorts and the immediate end to their mistreatment while in captivity.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also call upon Russia, as a signatory to the Vienna document, to help secure their release and to confirm publicly, even if belatedly, for the record that the abducted monitors were part of a legitimate mission on behalf of the international community.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Since 17 April, the Government of Ukraine has acted in good faith and with admirable restraint to fulfil its commitments.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Kyiv city hall and its surrounding area are now clear of all Maidan barricades and protestors.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Over the Easter holiday, Ukraine voluntarily suspended its counter-terrorism initiative, choosing to de-escalate despite its fundamental right to provide security on its own territory and for its own people.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unlike the separatists, Ukraine has cooperated fully with the OSCE special monitoring mission and allowed its observers to operate in regions about which Moscow had voiced concerns regarding the treatment of ethnic Russians.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In addition, Prime Minister Yatsenyuk has publicly committed his Government to undertake far-reaching constitutional reforms that will strengthen the power of the regions.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He has appealed personally to Russian-speaking Ukrainians, pledging to support special status for the Russian language and to protect those who use it.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He announced legislation to grant amnesty to those who surrender arms.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All of that should be cause for optimism and hope.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Tragically, what we have seen from Russia since 17 April is exactly what we saw from Russia prior to 17 April: more attempts to stir up trouble, more efforts to undermine the Government of Ukraine and statement after statement at odds with the facts.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What we have not seen is a single positive step by Russia to fulfil its Geneva commitments.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Instead, Russian officials have refused to publicly call on the separatists to give up their weapons and relinquish their illegal control of Ukrainian Government buildings.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In fact, Russia continues to fund, to coordinate and to fuel the heavily armed separatist movement.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In addition, just outside of Ukraine's border, Russia has continued to engage in threatening troop movements that are designed not to calm tensions, but to embolden the separatists and to intimidate the Government.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In conclusion, I emphasize that the United States remains committed to supporting the principles of the Charter of the United Nations and will continue to uphold the territorial integrity and sovereignty of Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We continue to seek stability within a peaceful, democratic, inclusive and united Ukraine, especially in advance of the upcoming important elections.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We remain committed to a diplomatic process, but Russia seems committed to destabilization and fantastical justifications for its actions.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The truth about what is happening in Ukraine should guide our discussion, because truth is the only foundation on which an equitable and lasting solution to this crisis can be based.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I wish to thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The crisis in Ukraine is the result of a complex fabric of historical and contemporary factors.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A political solution is the only way to end the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To tackle the crisis at its roots, both the current situation and the historical facts must be considered, taking into account the legitimate rights, interests and demands of the various regions and ethnic communities of Ukraine and the legitimate concerns of all the parties concerned, with a view to achieving a balance ofinterests for all.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: For some time now, various parties including China, have been vigorously engaged in mediation efforts and pushing for talks in order to ease the crisis in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Geneva agreement reached between Russia, the United States, the European Union and Ukraine calls for measures to de-escalate the Ukrainian situation, thereby sending a positive signal for a political solution to the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Regrettably, tensions in eastern and south- eastern Ukraine have worsened, with each side more vehemently accusing the other.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Threats and sanctions have again replaced dialogue and negotiation.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China hopes that all parties concerned will keep in mind the broader picture of regional peace and stability, and the fundamental interests of all ethnic groups in Ukraine, maintain restraint, persevere in dialogue and consultations, effectively implement the agreement already reached by all of the parties and continue to push for a political solution to the crisis so as to achieve stability and development in Ukraine as soon as possible.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China's position on the question of Ukraine remains objective, impartial and responsible.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: From the very beginning, China has called on all parties to seek a political solution through dialogue rather than confrontation, and we support international mediation efforts conducive to de-escalating the situation and seeking a political solution.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China will continue to play a constructive role in mediation efforts and pushing for talks.
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Republic of Korea is deeply concerned over the continuing tensions in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Despite the agreement reached in Geneva on 17 April, the situation in Ukraine is showing no signs of abating.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are troubled in particular by the continuing violence and aggressive provocations by illegal armed groups, including the seizure of key public buildings and the recent assassination attempt against the Mayor of the eastern city of Kharkiv.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All provocative actions and hostile rhetoric aimed at destabilizing Ukraine must cease immediately.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As agreed in the Geneva statement, all illegal armed groups must be disarmed and all illegally seized key public buildings vacated.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We strongly condemn the detention of military monitors of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE), as well as of Ukrainian staff by illegal armed groups.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It should be noted that the OSCE monitoring mechanism is an indispensable tool for implementing the Geneva statement.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is unacceptable to target international observers who are working to de-escalate the volatile situation.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They must be released immediately and unconditionally.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The safety and security of all international personnel must be fully guaranteed by all actors on the ground.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the light of the ongoing situation in Ukraine, we reiterate that constructive dialogue among all concerned parties will be the only way to achieve a peaceful solution.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, we call for all parties to the Geneva statement to implement their commitments.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As Ukraine moves towards critical elections in May, it is all the more important to ensure the holding of fair and free elections in the country, without any intervention or influence by outside forces.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the Ukrainian Government will lead an inclusive and transparent constitutional process.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We once again reaffirm our full support for Ukraine's sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity.
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I join others in thanking Assistant Secretary-General for Political Affairs Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing on the developments concerning Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We share his assessment that the situation in eastern Ukraine is deteriorating alarmingly, especially in Kharkiv, Luhansk and in the Donetsk area.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are deeply concerned by the actions of the pro-Russian separatist militias backed by Russia, aimed at destabilizing eastern Ukraine and, it seems, preventing the holding of the presidential elections on 25 May.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These destabilizing actions have intensified again in recent days, with the proliferation of the illegal occupation of public buildings, an increasing number of attacks against the Ukrainian security forces and an increase in violence against the local population.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As others have already mentioned, just yesterday peaceful demonstrators in favour of the unity of the Ukraine were violently attacked by armed pro-Russian gangs armed with clubs and baseball bats in the city of Donetsk.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today hundreds of pro-Russian demonstrators seized the building of the regional administration and the prosecutor's office in the city of Luhansk, and stormed the police station.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We condemn those actions and the attacks targeting political figures in the strongest terms.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The torture and murder of the Horlivka city councillor, Volodymyr Rybak, whose remains were found last week near Sloviansk together with those of a young student from Kyiv, Yuriy Popravko, attest to the high level of violence.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday, the mayor of Kharkiv, Henadiy Kernes, was the target of an assassination attempt - there are differing interpretations with regard to the party responsible.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These crimes must be investigated and everything possible must be done to prevent similar cases in the future.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The violence of recent days shows once again the need to urgently de-escalate the situation.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We welcome the positive steps taken by Ukraine to fulfil the commitments set out in the Geneva statement adopted on 17 April by Ukraine, Russia, the European Union and the United States.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has proposed an amnesty for those who leave the buildings they occupy in eastern Ukraine, as long as they have not committed crimes.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is ready to launch an inclusive national dialogue on constitutional reform and decentralization, and has acted with restraint in response to the actions of armed militias in the east.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international community expects Russia, for its part, to take concrete steps to bring the separatists in eastern Ukraine to de-escalate in accordance with the commitments undertaken in the Geneva statement.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We expect Russia to use its influence over the separatist movements to convince them to seek dialogue with the Ukrainian Government instead of fighting.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia should publicly condemn the actions of the separatists aimed at destabilizing Ukraine and call on armed militants to leave the illegally occupied buildings.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Finally, the withdrawal of Russian forces from the Ukrainian border is an essential step for de-escalating tensions, especially in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We strongly condemn the kidnapping near the town of Sloviansk on 25 April of a team of military inspectors deployed under the 2011 Vienna document of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also condemn the temporary detention, on 27 April, of two members of the OSCE special monitoring mission in Yenakiyeve.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The safety of international observers deployed anywhere in Ukraine must be ensured by all parties.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The OSCE monitoring mission must be able to fulfil its role in the implementation of the Geneva statement.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on Russia to continue to use all of its influence on the pro-Russian separatists to encourage them to release unconditionally and promptly the seven inspectors from OSCE participating States that they have been holding hostage in Sloviansk for the past four days, as well as the Ukrainian personnel accompanying them.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also condemn the restrictions on media freedom and on the freedom of expression.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The detention and intimidation of journalists have increased over the past two weeks in the east of the country.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The day before yesterday, pro-Russian separatists took control of the regional public television station in Donetsk.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The OSCE Representative on Freedom of the Media, Ms. Dunja Mijatovie, has repeatedly warned against misinformation and propaganda.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to join her appeal and highlight that any limitations on the freedom of the press is unacceptable.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Nothing can take the place of direct, substantive dialogue between Kyiv and Moscow to find a diplomatic solution to the Ukraine crisis.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The crisis continues to worsen.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It will have harmful consequences for the entire region, Europe and beyond.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Geneva declaration of 17 April cannot remain a dead letter.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The alternative to dialogue and to de-escalation would have incalculable consequences for international peace and security.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing and his warning to the Council.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Australia strongly supported calls for the holding of tonight's briefing to give the Council an up-to-date sense of the continuing destabilization and increased tensions in eastern Ukraine, much of which has evidently been sponsored and condoned by the Russian Federation.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We, with the rest of the Council, welcomed the 17 April agreement reached in Geneva on steps to de-escalate the crisis, including commitments to refrain from further acts of violence and provocation.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That was a positive development and, we hoped, a demonstration of serious commitment to reduce tensions and work cooperatively towards a diplomatic and political solution to the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine is living up to its Geneva commitments.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has submitted to Parliament a draft law on amnesty for protesters who surrender their weapons.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has initiated a process of constitutional reform aimed at decentralizing power.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has committed to holding a broad public debate on possible constitutional changes and sought proposals for constitutional reform.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is working to disarm radical movements.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has also said that it will guarantee the rights of Russian speakers to use their own language.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has strongly condemned xenophobia, intolerance and anti-Semitism and begun an investigation into the distribution of anti-Semitic leaflets in Donetsk.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has invited all political groups to discuss ways to resolve the crisis in eastern Ukraine and it has supported the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) in its work to de-escalate tensions.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But what has Russian done since 17 April to honour its Geneva commitments?
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Disappointingly, all evidence at hand points to Russia's continued determination to promote instability and challenge Ukraine's authority over its sovereign territory.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia's claims that it has no agency in or influence over the actions of armed militia groups operating in eastern Ukraine are not credible.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The seizure of OSCE observers on 25 April in Sloviansk and their mistreatment and their continued detention is a deplorable and cynical act against impartial international personnel working to bring peace and stability to the region, an act clearly intended to impede the ability of all OSCE monitors to work in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call for their immediate release.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have also witnessed continued and extreme provocations, including military manoeuvres on the Russian side of the Ukrainian border and reported multiple violations of Ukrainian air space by Russian military aircraft.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have witnessed the deplorable shooting on 28 April of the Mayor of Kharkiv and the abduction and killing of a Horlivka City Council representative.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are seeing continued occupation of Government buildings by well-armed and coordinated paramilitary groups, including, today, the occupation of Government buildings in Lugansk.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are seeing the increasing intimidation of local populations and illegal detentions.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Under-Secretary-General Feltman has just reported to us increasing reports of violence, with people killed, wounded, beaten and tortured.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In those circumstances, it is appropriate and necessary for the Ukrainian Government itself to take measures to try to ensure security and protect its citizens in its own territory.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has shown considerable restraint in the face of extreme provocation, but it has a right to enforce the rule of law and respond in a manner proportionate to the circumstances.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We welcome Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs Lubkivsky's statement during his 25 April press conference at the United Nations that Ukraine would protect its people from provocation in a civilized manner so as to avoid bloodshed.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We welcome Ukraine's recent acceptance ofjurisdiction of the International Criminal Court (ICC) with respect to crimes committed in its territory from November last year to February 2014.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge Ukraine to extend the ICC's jurisdiction to crimes committed beyond that date and to accede to the ICC Statute.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: For its part, overwhelmingly, the international community remains united in its support for Ukraine's sovereignty and territory integrity and in its position that Russia cease its illegal intervention, interference and provocative actions in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Statements by other Security Council members tonight are further confirmation of that.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To conclude, Australia continues to call on Russia to meet its Geneva commitments, to allow Ukraine's elections on 25 May to proceed without interference or obstruction, which is the right of every sovereign nation, and to exercise its influence over separatist activists in Ukraine towards those ends.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The crisis remains very dangerously poised.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Active, genuine and immediate efforts by Russia to defuse it are imperative.
speaker: Mr. Quinlan
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The recent events in south-eastern Ukraine and the country as a whole are of the most serious concern.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Kyiv regime, spurred on by Western well-wishers, are stubbornly pushing the country to disaster.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today, Western colleagues have spoken many critical words regarding the activities of protesters in south-eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If our Western colleagues had actually demonstrated a tenth of that commitment to maintaining order during the events at the Maidan then perhaps the current crisis could have been prevented.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 17 April in Geneva, agreement was reached that all sides should refrain from any types of violence, intimidation or provocation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, in just a matter of days, there was a resumption ofthe so-called counter-terrorist, but actually punitive, operations - out and out violations of that agreement.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the south-east, there was a deployment of roughly 15,000 military personnel, tanks, armed vehicles, artillery, aircraft and subdivisions of Right Sector Banderists.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As the first attempts to bring military pressure to bear on the south-east led to the defection of some Ukrainian military to the side of the protesters, today the sub-units are staffed by those from the west of the country.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: One might wonder what political and psychological effect that has had on the south-east and how it ties in with the task of ensuring the territorial integrity of the country.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In Geneva, it seemed that there was a window of opportunity for a significant de-escalation of the situation in Ukraine at the beginning of broad national dialogue.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, almost immediately following the declarations and actions of the Kyiv Government authorities, it became clear that they had no intention of implementing the agreement, just as they did not intend to implement the agreement of 21 February.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In both cases, that treachery led to bloodshed.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, it is difficulty to speak of confidence in the current coalition in Kyiv when the defence and law-enforcement agencies are essentially controlled by the Svoboda Party, whose political platform is based on declarations issued by Nazi collaborators in June 1941.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Pursuant to those declarations, real Ukrainians should have collaborated with Hitler to establish a new order in Europe.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would recall that the collaborators and the followers of Bandera killed not only Jews, Poles and Soviet soldiers but also Ukrainians who refused to subscribe to their sloganeering.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In Geneva, there was agreement on the need for a full rejection of extremism.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, the Right Sector Banderists, instead of laying down their weapons, headed to the east of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As was declared, the Banderist army crossed the Dnepr.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Neither the Right Sector with its Nazi slogans nor any other radical organizations have laid down their arms.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the contrary, those groups have become legal.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are forming military battalions with names like Dnepr and Donbass in their ranks.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: How could the militias in the east be convinced to disarm or vacate buildings if they have been surrounded, as has happened in Sloviansk, by subdivisions of the Ukrainian armed forces and the so-called National Guard, comprised of fighters from the Right Sector.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In Geneva, there was agreement that there had to be a single approach to all illicit activities in Ukraine from whichever side they might emanate - that is, from Kyiv, the west, the east or the south.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, the Maidan remains occupied - cement blockades are still in place - as are several buildings in Kyiv.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: No one has liberated anything in Kyiv.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In Washington, DC, they are saying, uncritically, that the buildings have been legally rented.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But by whom?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They have been rented by armed fighters.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In Geneva, there was agreement that there should be amnesty for protestors.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, instead of that, the People's Governor of Donetsk, Pavel Gubarev, who never had weapons in his hand, remains in prison.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He is a political prisoner, arrested just because he called for a referendum on the federalization of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The monitors of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) confirm that he was tortured and that he is now engaged in an indefinite hunger strike.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Mr. Gubarev is far from being the only political prisoner of the Kyiv regime.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: One can speak of widespread witch hunts for those who have dared to express their disagreement with the Government in the Maidan.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: According to our sources, in the Donetsk region there are already about 10 cases of politically motivated kidnappings of people who were later transported to Kyiv by the special services.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 28 April, there was an attack on the life of the popular mayor of Kharkiv, Hennadiy Kernes.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My colleague from the United Kingdom rushed to say that the protesters in the south-east participated in that crime.
Target_Country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That demands a careful investigation of the case.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us not try to prejudge the outcome.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is true that Mr. Kernes had indeed spoken out about the chaos in other regions of Ukraine, and there were serious political battles between him and one of the heads of the defence and law-enforcement agencies.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the same day - 28 April - at the Kherson airport, the presidential candidate's plane was blocked.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He had been travelling as part ofthe presidential campaign.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He was attacked.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In early April another candidate, Oleh Tsarev, was severely beaten.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He was the only candidate for the presidential election without State protection.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Mr. Tsarev was stripped of his right to participate in the televised debates.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that context, can we speak about the peaceful nature of the electoral campaign in Ukraine and of freedom of expression for its civilians?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The key point of the Geneva agreement was broad national dialogue, which was to take into account the interests of all regions and political formations.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Kyiv Government made certain promises with regard to constitutional reforms and upholding the rights of minorities.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But what about national dialogue and reform?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: According to meadia reports, today Mr. Yatsenyuk submitted to the Rada some sort of draft constitution.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is not really clear how it was prepared.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What is certain is that it was not an open and inclusive process.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In fact, the Party of Regions, which represents the rest of the east of the country, was excluded from the process.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is no surprise that the draft was immediately criticized in the Rada by all sides.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We did not hear any reasonable answers to key questions, such as how the federalization or decentralization of the country would take place.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It seems such things are to be substituted by some type of broadening of municipalities.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: How is the issue of the status of the Russian language to be resolved?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Can anyone seriously assert that all those activities by Kyiv are a solution to the political crisis aimed at stabilizing Ukraine?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Instead of genuine collective work to bring Ukraine out of the crisis, which was brought about by political misadventurism, our colleagues from the United States and the European Union have preferred to make strong insinuations against Russia and thinking up some sort of sanctions that are pointless and counterproductive.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Perhaps they are satisfactory to some one, but the responsibility for the future of Ukraine, Europe and the world is not being considered - at least not by these people.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The result is that the Government in Kyiv has done nothing to implement the Geneva document.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our Western colleagues, first and foremost our American colleagues, which have an unprecedented impact on the situation in Kyiv, do not want, or have not been able, to convince the Government to uphold its obligations under the document.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They must clearly understand the scope of their responsibility if the situation in Ukraine continues to deteriorate.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is very difficult for us in Russia to see the chaos in such a close, fraternal country.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But we understand the reason that brought about the protests in the east and south.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: People do not want a repeat of the Kyiv scenario.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They do not recognize the legitimacy of the Kyiv Government, which is made up of oligarchs.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They have decided to create their own governing bodies.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In response, they have been accused of terrorism and punished by military operations.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call upon the Kyiv regime and its Western sponsors to think twice.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is a need to lift the order on using arms against civilians, as well as to free the political prisoners and disarm the Right Sector.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A full constitutional process must take place, including representatives from all regions.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the OSCE mission, headed by Mr. Apakan, which plays a particular role in the implementation of the Geneva agreement, will provide the Kyiv Government with assistance in establishing national dialogue and seeking understanding with the people in the south-east.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, the most important work to de-escalate should be done by the Kyiv Government - as they call themselves.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I should now like to say a few words with regard to the issues touched on by colleagues.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the OSCE monitors in Sloviansk, they were requested by the Kyiv Government, and as such were responsible for their security.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: How can people be sent on a bus to an area controlled by self-defence forces, without even providing documents that would confirm their status?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That was either a provocation by the Kyiv Government or just simple stupidity.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are doing everything we can for the freeing of those prisoners, and one has already been released due to health reasons.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With regard to armed forces, our armed forces are on Russian territory.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: American forces are hardly at home.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are in Australia, Lithuania, Poland and on the Black Sea, where an American vessel has remained longer than it was invited to do.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yes, our troops do conduct training exercises.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But they do so in atransparent manner and while upholding all existing international agreements.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We do not have any aggressive intentions towards Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They Kyiv Government should keep a cool head and not engage in reckless activities with respect to the people in the south-east of the country, where there are many Russian citizens as well.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let me thank the Nigerian presidency for convening this open meeting, which does not cease to surprise us, judging by some of the statements we have heard.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I might refer to some of the comments by our colleague from the Russian Federation.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would also like to thank Under Secretary-General Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As so many of us have said here, the international community had placed high hopes on international mediation and monitoring efforts and on the 17 April Geneva statement on Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But, as we know today, the Geneva statement is just another document to be signed and discarded by Russia, adding to the growing list of breaches of Russia's international commitments, such as the Helsinki Final Act, the 1991 Almaty Declaration, the Budapest Memorandum of 1994, the Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation between Russia and Ukraine of l997 and the Charter of the United Nations itself.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Despite growing provocations, the Ukrainian authorities have taken a number of concrete steps to follow up on the Geneva statement.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Barricades in Maidan Square are being dismantled.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I recall my French colleague referring a number of times to the Internet and Google.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Users of those will see that there is a significant difference in terms of what is happening on the streets of Kyiv.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As I said, barricades are being dismantled.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Kiyv city administration building has re-opened, as has the main thoroughfare of the city, Khreschatik.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Important proposals regarding the status of the Russian language, amnesty, greater rights for the regions, as well as limitations on the President's power, have been put forward by the transitional Governmet.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indeed, as Ambassador Churkin referred to earlier today, constitutional reform was being discussed by the Parliament in a public session accessible to all.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There has been a major debate on what was being proposed.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But, again, a major debate that includes criticism is a sign of democracy.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unanimous decisions and acceptance of whatever is put on the table is something that abelongs to regimes, not democratic Governments.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We therefore welcome the discussion.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is necessary and it is something Kyiv has to do, and should be doing actively while involving all the regions and populations, because it affects the lives of the entire population of Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Other issues discussedtoday include decentralization, constitutional reform, checks and balances, the powers of the President in the future, a stronger role for and the reinforcement of the independence of the judiciary, and so forth.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Preparations are taking place for the national elections to be held on 25 May.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In a stark contrast to those efforts, armed separatists, aidead and abetted by Russia, are continuing their assault on Ukraine, adding violence to force and lawlessness to impunity.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As many noted earlier, yesterday and today saw more violent attacks in the city of Luhansk and elsewhere - in Mykolaiv and in Konstiantynivka - where men armed with clubs and metal bars smashed windows and doors.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A pro-unity rally was attacked by men in military fatigues, leading to over a dozen injuries among pro-Ukrainian protesters.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A few days ago, a Ukrainian helicopter was downed by a rocket-propelled grenade, hardly a weapon so-called peaceful protesters - as labelled by the Russian side - can buy at the local corner market.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That certainly does not sound like the implementation of Geneva agreement by the separatists and their state sponsors?
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Displays of brutal force, beatings, disappearances, torture, killings and hostage-taking have become a daily reality in eastern Ukraine under militant separatist rule.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: While quick to condemn and brand Ukrainian authorities for alleged crimes, Russia has yet to issue a single condemnation of the violence carried out by armed separatists.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The legitimate right of Ukraine, to which our Australian colleague has referred, to defend its territory and its State has been exercised with incredible restraint and caution, although portrayed by the Russian propaganda machinery as a bloodbath and a valid cause for intervention.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: From the speaker before me, we heard references to military punitive operations and acts.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If what Ukraine is carrying out in the eastern part of its country is a military punitive action, it is probably the most invisible, impossible military action on Earth.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Nothing has happened in that sense.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To exaggerate to such an extent is going a long way in terms of exaggeration.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On the other hand, in a threatening tone, Russia recently ordered Ukraine to withdraw Ukrainian troops stationed on Ukraine's own soil, or else - so much for respect for Ukraine's international sovereignty.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We firmly reject all of Russia's attempts to validate its intentions and threats to use armed forces or to send so-called Russian peacekeepers into Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As a permanent member of the Security Council, Russia should know better than to exploit the name of peacekeeping to cover up its aggressive expansionist aims.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Now I would like to turn to human rights and the media.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) Representative on the Freedom of the Media, Mr. Dunja Mijatovic', is sounding increasing alarm regarding the treatment of journalists and the deterioration of media freedom in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In areas under the control of pro-Russian militants, journalists are attacked, detained, harassed and their equipment taken or smashed.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is probably something to hide if there is such a distaste and dislike of free media in that part of Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We reiterate our call to end impunity for attacks against journalists.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also call for a thorough investigation of kidnappings, torture and killings, committed by whomever, and to insist that the perpetrators of all such acts be brought to justice.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the next report of the United Nations human rights monitoring mission in Ukraine, to be issued in mid-May, will address the growing cases of human rights violations, violent deaths, causes for torture, abductions and activist disappearances in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also hope the report will look into the human rights situation in occupied Crimea.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As has been reported, the Crimean Tatar leader Mustafa Dzhemilev has been barred from returning home to Crimea.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A group of camouflage-clad men stormed the Tatar Assembly offices and tore down the Ukrainian flag there.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The director and editor of Crimean Tatar programmes on Crimean State television have been forced out by local authorities because they had spoken against increasing censorship.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A new level of banditry by the separatists in eastern Ukraine was reached on 25 April, when they kidnapped a group of OSCE representatives.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Notably, when asked to release the hostages, the separatists were quoted as saying that they needed to speak to the competent authorities in the Russian Federation.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My delegation strongly condemns the kidnapping of unarmed OSCE military verification mission observers and Ukrainian security personnel.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Such acts, as well as the public parading of the hostages, speak loudly to the true character and intentions of the separatists, who seek to disrupt international observation so that they can continue attacking Ukraine out of sight of the international community.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The parties with influence on the militant separatists, first and foremost Russia, must take all necessary steps to bring about the immediate release of all hostages, without preconditions.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international monitoring and mediation efforts of the United Nations, OSCE and other regional bodies must be fully supported, guaranteed safety and security, and allowed full freedom of access on all of Ukraine's territory.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As Ukraine prepares for the 25 May nation-wide elections, those opposed to Ukraine's independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity are at it again.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To quote the self-proclaimed people's mayor of Sloviansk, Vyacheslav Ponomarev, "We will take all necessary measures so that elections do not take place in the south-east".
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: When asked what they would be ready to do, he said: "We will take somebody hostage and hang them up by the balls.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is real, you understand?"
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The intent here could not be more clear - it is to prevent Ukraine's return to normality.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine
