sentence_text: We all understand that there are legitimate complaints in south-eastern Ukraine, borne out of decades of mismanagement and corruption and misrule, including the rule of the previous President, Yanukovych, who fled the country in disgrace.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is time for the current Government to start seriously addressing issues of socioeconomic development because a lot of that discontent is based on the socioeconomic concerns of the population.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Once those issues are addressed, the level of so-called separatism, I am sure, will diminish.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That should not happen, according to some, because it would go against the scenario.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My Government condemns the actions of armed separatists and their external sponsors, aimed at further undermining and threatening the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The onus is now on Russia to stop interfering in Ukraine's internal affairs and fomenting unrest in Ukraine, and to abandon its threats of the use of force.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine is doing its part to implement the Geneva agreement on Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is time for Russia to live up to its own commitments and to reclaim respect for the Charter of the United Nations and international law.
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank you for convening this meeting, Madam President, and for the opportunity to address the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would also like to thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing, and all the members of the Council for their statement.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has been a month since Russia illegally occupied and annexed Crimea, using its military forces and brutally violating international law.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, Russia has not stopped there, and apparently its leaders are now targeting other parts of Ukraine and brazenly interfering in its internal affairs.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The agreements reached at the Geneva meeting of the Foreign Ministers of Ukraine, the Russian Federation, the United States and the European Union on 17 April provided a faint beam of hope for a diplomatic solution.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In order to implement the Geneva statement for the de-escalation of the situation in the eastern regions of Ukraine, the Government of Ukraine immediately took the necessary practical steps.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Within just one week, the Government suspended the active phase of its anti-terrorist operation, whose main objective was the restoration of law and order and the protection of civilians.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It initiated constitutional reform.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It approved the concept of local administrative reform, whose main principles are decentralizing power in the country, significantly empowering local communities and improving management at the regional and district levels.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A draft law on amnesty for participants in the uprisings in the eastern regions has been prepared and would apply to those protesters who surrender their weapons and evacuate illegally seized administrative buildings, except for those suspected of committing serious crimes.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The parliamentary coalition has invited all political parties represented in the Ukrainian Parliament to sign a memorandum of understanding on ways to resolve the situation in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Minister of Internal Affairs and Security Services has continued implementing a nationwide campaign to seize illegal arms from the population, and more than 6,000 weapons have been handed over recently.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine is demonstrating its commitment to constructive cooperation with human-rights institutions and international organizations.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What has Russia done for its part of the Geneva document?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has done nothing.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Because of the lack of support for the separatists among the population of eastern Ukraine, Russia is seeking new ways to destabilize the situation in the region, preparing and carrying out numerous armed provocations through its agents.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian-sponsored illegal paramilitary units have continued to destabilize the situation in eastern Ukraine, preparing the ground for a new stage of military aggression.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Russian leadership has done nothing to publicly dissociate itself from the armed separatists and provocateurs or to urge them to immediately lay down their arms and release captured administrative buildings.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia has not even condemned the seizure of hostages, including journalists, or separatists' open acts of xenophobia and anti-Semitism.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Any attempts by Russia to show that the Ukrainian Government is trying to use force against the peaceful Ukrainian population are lies.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our Government respects freedom of expression and the right to peaceful assembly, which are guaranteed by the Constitution of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, when heavily armed, professionally trained groups led by Russian military seize law-enforcement facilities and administrative offices, kill Ukrainian police officers and take hostages, they are operating like terrorists and must be treated accordingly.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainian counter-terrorism operations are targeted exclusively at illegal armed groups threatening civilians.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Meanwhile, the Russian-controlled army groups are in fact holding the entire civilian population of several towns in the eastern region hostage and have thus transgressed the bounds of humanity.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I will list some facts.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Three Ukrainian law-enforcement officers were abducted, brutally beaten, tortured and later presented to the Russian media as Ukrainian spies, blindfolded and with their hands tied.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainian and foreign journalists are being systematically kidnapped, while Russian journalists are allowed to operate in the areas controlled by the illegal armed groups.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A military helicopter was destroyed with a man-portable air defence (MANPAD) guided missile.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It should be understood that peaceful protesters cannot buy MANPADs in shops.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Representatives of the military verification mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) were taken hostage in Sloviansk.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The detention by force of international observers is yet another testament to the criminal and terrorist nature of the separatist armed groups.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In contrast to the demand voiced in many of the statements in the Council today that those hostages be released, the Russian Federation, as might be expected, made no such demand; nor have its leaders in Moscow.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What is important is that the leaders of the illegal armed groups have publicly admitted responsibility for all the aforementioned crimes * even on television.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Many members of the illegal militant groups are citizens of the Russian Federation, and they are not even trying to hide it, publicly displaying their identification.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We recently read an article in The New York Times in which the Kuban Cossack Mozhaev declared his presence and that of an armed group from his region, which we had noticed in Crimea as well.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainian law-enforcement agencies have credible evidence of these persons' involvement in serious crimes.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today, some ofthose crimes have been described.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Among them was the brutal story of Volodymyr Rybak, a member of Horlivka's City Council, and Yuriy Popravko, a l9-year-old activist from Kyiv, who were martyred by members of terrorist groups.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Their bodies, mutilated by torture, were found in the Torets River in the vicinity of Sloviansk.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Volodymyr Rybak disappeared on 17 April in Horlivka after he tried to remove the separatists' flag from the building of Horlivka City Council.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A video of the kidnapping, as well as audio recordings of phone conversations intercepted by Ukraine's Security Service, provided sufficient proof that terrorist leaders, notably the self-proclaimed mayor of Sloviansk, Vyacheslav Ponomaryov, and the military commander of the terrorists, the Russian agent Igor Strelkov, were involved in the murder.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The true identity of the Russian agent has been established as Colonel Igor Girkin of Russian military intelligence, who is registered as a permanent resident of Moscow.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Government of Ukraine strongly condemns the aforementioned acts of terror and violence, including yesterday's attempt to assassinate the Mayor of Kharkiv, Hennadiy Kernes, who publicly supported the unity and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, Russia has not even publicly condemned or dissociated itself from those acts of terror and violence perpetrated by illegal militants since the Geneva agreement.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to remind the Council that Russia used to deny that its armed forces participated in the occupation of Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, President Putin now openly admits the use of Russian military forces and praises them for their heroism and the successful completion of the operation aimed at the reunification of Crimea with Russia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They have even issued a special medal of honour.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And now, in spite of numerous irrefutable facts concerning Russian military involvement in organizing and guiding illegal armed groups in eastern Ukraine, Moscow denies any Russian military participation just as hard.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Furthermore, Russia is now threatenting to use force, as demonstrated by its concentration of armed forces directly on the eastern border of our country.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The number of units along Ukraine's borders has increased.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Last week, we all heard intensified militaristic rhetoric from senior Russian officials, including President Putin, Minister Lavrov and Minister Shoigu, threatening to send Russian troops into the territory of Ukrain under various pretexts.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Defence Minister Shoigu reported the start of new military exercises by battalion tactical groups from the southern and western military districts of the Russian armed forces in connection with "the deteriorating situation in southeastern Ukraine".
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With that the Russian side has in fact confirmed that its military activity near the Ukrainian border in the past month has not been routine in nature, but directly related to the developments in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, the withdrawal of troops announced by Minister Shoigu yesterday has not come true.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We still observe those troops near our borders.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My British colleague has given us information about the strange statement by our Russian partner here, who said that, in case of events taking a bad turn in Ukraine's south-east, Russia would remember the provision to use armed forces in Ukraine given to President Vladimir Putin by the Federation Council.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He also said that Russia had an international legal basis for sending its peacekeeping troops into Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And he referred to the right to self-defence under Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations, which Russia used during the conflict in the Caucasus in 2008.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text:
The right to self-defence on the territory of another country?
Let me remind him that Ukraine has never threatened Russia, and never will.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainians want to live in peace and to be left alone.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The highest level of cynicism is the Russian reference to the right of self-defence in a situation in which it is Russia that is acting as aggressor, having occupied Crimea, as is brutally interfering in the internal affairs of Ukraine, destabilizing it and trying to create an explosive situation in the eastern regions.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, we are deeply concerned that the scenario that is prepared for eastern Ukraine might be similar to the one implemented by Russia in Abkhazia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That scenario might include several steps.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Step one: a small group of local separatists, supported by Russian-controlled armed groups, would seize control over regional councils and make them illegally proclaim the creation ofa so-called independent Novorossiya within the boundaries described by President Putin at his recent press interview.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have already seen that step taken in Donetsk, Slovansk and Kharkiv, against the will of the vast majority of the local population and against the Ukrainian Constitution.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Step two: the Russian Federation would immediately recognize such a regional unit as an independent State.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Step three: upon a request from the newly self-proclaimed authorities, the Russian Federation would send its troops to Ukraine under the guise of peacekeepers or collective self-defence.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, I must say that such a scenario is realistic, as it has been reported that some Russian heavy military vehicles had been spotted near Ukraine's borders bearing signs indicating "Peacekeeping Mission" in the Russian and Ukrainian languages, exactly as happened in Abkhazia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: One of the main purposes of that scenario is to disrupt the presidential elections scheduled for 25 May, which are a top priority for the Government and for the people of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let me sum up my statement by making some short conclusions.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Twelve days have already passed since the Geneva meeting.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine has done its utmost to de-escalate the situation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our steps have been acknowledged and supported by the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and other parties involved.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia has done nothing.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: How should the problem be solved?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The answer is simple: Russia has to implement the Geneva agreements.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: First, Russia should withdraw its army from Ukraine's borders.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Secondly, it should make a high-level statement calling on its prote'ges to free all hostages, to disarm and to vacate all seized administrative premises.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It also has to condemn all terror and violence committed by those groups and to disassociate itself from such activities.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Thirdly, it should stop its war-like rhetoric and start to act in a constructive and civilized manner.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Last, but not least, Russia must refrain from any actions aimed at undermining the 25 May presidential elections in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on the Security Council to give the most serious assessment of the actions and statements by Russia regarding Ukraine, and to take the most decisive steps to stop its aggressive appetite and to protect Ukrainian territorial integrity, which has been challenged once again.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I certainly do not want to prolong our meeting here this evening.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The simplest of answers would be to again read the statement I made earlier, which refletcts our vision and position.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, allow me a very brief comment.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A great deal has been said here about some sort of wrong interpretation of our positions and statements in various forums and situations.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our Ukrainian colleague even began to depict some fantastic scenario of how he views the further developments unfolding in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The only scenario that I would want to hear - but do not - is one that includes genuine efforts by the authorities in Kyiv to implement the Geneva document.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Mr.Feltman began by saying that there were various interpretation of that document.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The document is so simple, there is nothing to interpret.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is nothing to be done but to implement it.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us do so.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia helped to draw it up.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But the actions backing it up need to be taken, first and foremost, by the authorities in Kyiv, if that is what they are.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, their lack of action is reflected in the statement I made here earlier today.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We meet today in the most tragic of circumstances.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday, Malaysia Airlines passenger flight MH-l7 appears to have been shot down over eastern Ukraine, killing all passengers and crew.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our deepest, most heartfelt condolences go to the families of the victims and to the people and Governments of those countries affected.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the United Kingdom, we are mourning the loss of at least nine British citizens who were passengers on the flight.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is a dark moment for the international community.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The senseless violence unleashed by armed separatists in eastern Ukraine has reached monstrous proportions.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The precise circumstances and causes of this tragic event must be established quickly and beyond any doubt.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As the Council has affirmed this morning, that will require a full, thorough and independent international investigation, in accordance with international civil aviation guidelines.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The International Civil Aviation Organization, which provides the international legal framework for the investigation of air accidents, should have a central role to play in ensuring that there is credible and independent international involvement.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We welcome the indications from the Ukrainian authorities that they want international investigators to join their efforts.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom will provide whatever assistance is necessary to support that investigation.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The immediate priority has to be for investigators to gain access to the crash site so they can start their work.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They must be able to operate unhindered and in security.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There must be no interference or tampering with the evidence.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Armed separatist groups in the vicinity must allow such access.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Despite assurances made yesterday evening, we understand that has not yet happened.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on Russia to use its influence with those groups to ensure that it happens.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The special monitoring mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe already present in eastern Ukraine can play a key role in facilitating and safeguarding access.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Early indications are that Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-l7 was brought down by a surface-to-air missile.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The MH-17 is not the first aircraft to be brought down in the area.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 14 June, armed separatists claimed responsibility for - indeed, gloated publicly over 4 the shooting down of a Ukrainian I1-76 transport aircraft, with a loss of all 49 aboard.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 14 July, armed separatists shot down an An-26 transport aircraft with a surface-to-air missile.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And, on 16 July, a Ukrainian Su-25 jet was shot down in circumstances that have yet to be fully clarified.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have to ask searching questions about why we are now confronting this tragic situation.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian officials have claimed that armed separatists in eastern Ukraine represent a spontaneous local insurgency.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We know that is not the case.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We know that the three leading figures of the so-called Donetsk People's Republic are Russian citizens who have come from outside Ukraine.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We know that weapons, equipment and logistical support have been systematically provided to armed separatist groups by Russia, including up to 100 man-portable air defence systems and 15 to 25 main battle tanks, not to mention artillery pieces, rocket launchers and other armoured vehicles.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The United Kingdom urges Russia to reflect carefully on the situation it has created.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge Russia to cease its policy of supporting armed separatist groups and their violent actions of destabilizing a neighbouring country and of generating displacement and social and economic hardship.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us hear today a clear and unequivocal condemnation from Russia of the actions of these armed groups.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These armed groups do not represent the people of Ukraine; without Russian support, they would wither.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is the Council's responsibility to respond to such tragedies by drawing the right lessons and working together with commitment and conviction to prevent their repetition.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is clear where responsibility lies: with the senseless violence of armed separatists and with those who have supported, equipped and advised them.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council must be united in condemning these actions and in demanding that these groups disarm, desist from violence and intimidation and engage in dialogue through the democratic mechanisms that are available to them.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They have been given opportunities to do so, most recently through President Poroshenko's peace plan.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those opportunities have all been spurned.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the press statement agreed earlier today, the members of the Security Council expressed their condolences and called for an international investigation and appropriate accountability.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is welcome, but it is not enough.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council must go further.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It should come together behind a clear demand that the armed separatist groups should lay down their arms and pursue whatever political legitimate objectives they may have through exclusively peaceful and democratic means, and that the flow of arms, fighters and logistical support to the armed separatists be fully halted and the borders secured.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the light of yesterday's tragedy, any other course of action would be unconscionable.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday we were all shocked by the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All 298 people aboard - 283 passangers and 15 crew members - were killed.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As we stared at the passanger list yesterday, we saw next to three of the passangers' names a capital "I".
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As we now know, that letter stands for "infant".
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To the families and friends of the victims, it is impossible to find words to express our condolences.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We can only commit to them that we will not rest until we find out what happened.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A full, credible and unimpeded international investigation must begin immediately.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The perpetrators must be brought to justice; they must not be sheltered by any State Member of the United Nations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let me share with the Council our assesment of the evidence so far.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We assess that Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, carrying 298 people from Amsterdan to Kuala Lumpur, was likely downed by a surface-to-air missile (SAM) - an SA-11 - operated from a separatist-held location in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The airliner was travelling at a cruise altitude of 33,000 feet, and its speed was typical for an airliner along an established flight corridor frequented by commercial traffic.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The flight was transmiting its assigned transponder code, corresponding with its flight plan, and flight tracking data was publicly available on the Internet.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There was nothing threatening or provocative about MH-17.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Of the operational SAM.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: systems located near the border, only the SA-Il, SA-20 and SA-22 systems are capable of hitting an aircraft at the flight's altitude of 33,000 feet.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We can rule out shorter-range SAMSs known to be in separatist hands, including man-portable air defence systems, and SA-8 and SA-13 systems, which are not capable of hitting an aircraft at that altitude.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Early Thursday, an SA-ll SAM.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: system was reported near Zahnitkiv by a western reporter, and separatists were spotted hours before the incident with an SA-Il system at a location close to the site where the plane went down.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Separatists initially claimed responsibility for shooting down a military transport plane, and posted videos that are now being connected to the Malaysia Airlines crash.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Separatist leaders also boasted on social media about shooting down a plane, but later deleted those messages.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Because of the technical complexity of the SA-11, it is unlikely that the separatists could effectively operate the system without assistance from knowledgeable personnel.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Therefore, we cannot rule out technical assistance from Russian personnel in operating the systems.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainians do have SA-ll systems in their inventory; however, we are not aware of any Ukrainian SAM.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: systems in the area of the shoot-down.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: More important, since the beginning of the crisis Ukrainian air defences have not fired a single missile, despite several alleged violations of their airspace by Russian aircraft.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This also follows a pattern of actions by Russian-backed separatists.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 13 June, separatists shot down a Ukrainian transport plane carrying 40 paratroopers and 9 crew members.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 24 June, as the Council was meeting to welcome Ukraine's unilateral ceasefire (see S/PV.7205), we received word that separatists had downed a Ukrainian helicopter, killing all nine aboard.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On 14 July, separatists claimed credit for downing a Ukrainian military cargo plane flying at 6,000 metres.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: And on 16 July they claimed credit for the downing of a Ukrainian fighter jet.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If indeed Russian-backed separatists were behind this attack on a civilian airliner, they and their backers would have good reason to cover up evidence of their crime.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is therefore extremely important that an investigation be commenced immediately.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the first instance, the special monitoring mission the of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe should act as a first responder, thereby laying the foundation for efforts by other international organizations and individual nations, including those whose citizens were victims of the tragedy.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday, President Obama assured Ukraine's President Poroshenko that United States experts would offer all possible assistance upon his request.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: President Poroshenko has invited the independent and credible International Civil Aviation Organization to join an investigation.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: International investigators must be granted immediate, full and unfettered access to the crash site.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All those concerned - Russia, pro-Russian separatists and Ukraine - should agree to support an immediate ceasefire to facilitate access by international investigators.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, we look to the monitoring misson also to reach agreement with separatists and others in the region to make that possible.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All evidence must remain undisturbed and any evidence removed from the site by the Russian-backed separatists operating in the area should be promptly returned and handed over.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia needs to help make that happen.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: While it make take us some time to firmly establish who shot down a plane filled with innocents, most Council members and most members of the international community have been warning for months about the devastation that would come if Russia did not stop what it started - if it did not reign in what it unleashed.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The context for yesterday's horror is clear: separatist forces backed by the Russian Government continue to destabilize Ukraine and undermine the efforts of Ukraine's elected leaders to build a democratic Ukraine that is stable, unified, secure and able to determine its own future.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia says that it seeks peace in Ukraine, but we have repeatedly provided the Council with evidence of Russia's continued support to the separatists.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Time after time, we have called on the Russian Government to de-escalate the situation by stopping the flow of fighters and weapons into Ukraine, pressing separatists to agree to a ceasefire and release all hostages, and support a road map for negotiations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Time after time, President Putin has committed to working towards dialogue and peace - in Geneva in April, in Normandy in June and in Berlin earlier this month - and every single time he has broken that commitment.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Here is what we know.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the past few weeks, Russia has increased the number of tanks, armoured vehicles and rocket launchers in south-west Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: More advanced air defence systems have also arrived.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Moscow recently transferred Soviet- era tanks and artillery to the separatists, and several military vehicles crossed the border.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: After recapturing several Ukrainian cities last weekend, Ukrainian officials discovered caches of weapons long associated with Russian stockpiles, including MANPADs, mines, grenades, meals ready to eat, vehicles and a pontoon bridge.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainian forces have discovered large amounts of other Russian-provided military equipment, including accompanying documentation verifying Russian origin, in the areas they have liberated from separatists in recent days.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Recruiting efforts for separatist fighters are expanding inside Russia, and separatists have openly said that they were looking for volunteers with experience in operating heavy weapons such as tanks and air defences.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia has allowed officials from the Donetsk People's Republic to establish a recruiting office in Moscow.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainian pilot Nadia Savchenko, who has long had a distinguished career in the Ukrainian military, was taken by separatists in mid-June.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: She is now being held - where? -
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: in a prison in Voronezh, Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: According to the Ukrainian Government, she was transferred to Russia by separatists.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia continues to redeploy new forces extremely close to the Ukrainian border.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In addition, on Monday, a Ukrainian air force cargo plane was shot down in Ukrainian air space, and on Wednesday a Ukrainian fighter jet was also shot down in Ukrainian air space.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In both instances, the Ukrainian Government believes that the planes were fired on from Russian territory.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is because of such continued destabilizing Russian actions that the United States imposed sanctions on the defence, energy and financial sectors of the Russian economy, including financial institutions.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The measures include freezing the assets ofRussian defence companies and blocking new financing of some of Russia's most important banks and energy companies.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The sanctions are significant, but they are also targeted and designed to have the maximum impact on the Russian calculus while limiting the impact on the Russian people and any spillover effects on our interests or those of our allies.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This week, the European Union also announced expanded sanctions on Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The message is unified and clear: if President Putin continues to choose escalation over de-escalation, the international community will continue to impose costs on Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But that is not what any of us want.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We and our allies remain committed to a diplomatic solution, as are the Ukrainian Government and the Ukrainian people, who have seen their neighbours, friends and family members killed in a needless conflict.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: President Poroshenko has consistently backed up his words with actions.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He proposed a comprehensive peace plan and declared a unilateral ceasefire, both of which were cynically rejected by the illegal armed groups and their backers in Moscow.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: President Poroshenko's plan offered amnesty to separatists who voluntarily laid down their arms and who are not guilty of capital crimes.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He committed to providing a safe corridor for Russian fighters to return to Russia.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He established a job-creation programme for the affected areas, made an offer of broad decentralization and dialogue with eastern regions, including the promise of early local elections, and granted increased local control over language, holidays and customs.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: President Poroshenko has also reached out to the regions of eastern Ukraine and is pursuing constitutional reforms that will give local regions more authority to choose their regional leaders and protect locally spoken languages.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: He has said that he will meet with separatists in any safe location, inside or outside Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The goal of the United States throughout the crisis in Ukraine has been consistent, namely, to support a stable, peaceful and democratic Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We will not be satisfied with a temporary halt to violence.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia must stop destabilizing Ukraine and allow all the people of Ukraine to decide their country's future through a democratic political process.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As we sit here, the remains of nearly 300 people - innocent infants, children, women and men - are strewn across a blackened, smouldering landscape in Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The victims came from at least nine different nations; they could just as easily have come from any of ours.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We must treat all of them as our own victims.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have a duty to each and every one of those individuals, their families and their countries to determine why that jet fell out of the sky and to hold the perpetrators accountable.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We must stop at nothing to bring those responsible to justice.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This appalling attack occurred in the context of a crisis that has been fuelled by Russian support for separatists through arms, weapons and training, by the Russian failure to follow through on its commitments and by its failure to adhere to the fundamental principles of the United Nations Charter.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The tragedy only underscores the urgency and the determination with which we insist that Russia immediately take concrete steps to de-escalate the situation in Ukraine, support a sustainable ceasefire and follow the path towards peace that the Ukrainian Government has consistently offered.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This war can be ended.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia can end this war.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia must end this war.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are deeply shocked by yesterday's downing of a Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We express our sincere condolences to Malaysia, the Netherlands, Australia, Indonesia, the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium, the Philippines, Canada and the other nations whose citizens were among the 298 people who perished.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our deepest sympathies go to the families of the victims.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The circumstances ofthe downing mustbe established by an independent, international investigaton, in accordance with international civil aviation guidelines.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The perpetrators cannot escape responsibility.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Investigators must immediately be granted access to the crash site and the black boxes must be handed over to independent authorities in order to prevent the evidence being tampered with.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The circumstances are impossible to ignore.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They all point in one direction, namely, that this horrible crime was committed as part of the armed aggression against Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The responsibility for that terror act lies with those who are aggressively preventing Ukraine from effectively exercising its sovereign rights over its territory and airspace.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It would not have happened had Russia not armed and instigated the presence of separatist groups in Donetsk and Luhansk provinces.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international community cannot stand by in the face of such aggression.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The country has become a threat to international peace and security.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have said that all along since the occupation of Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The debris of the Malaysian plane lies in an area controlled by pro-Russian separatists.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This week alone, a Ukrainian AN-26 cargo plane and an Su-25 fighter jet were shot down by pro-Russian separatists from a high altitude.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The third - a Malaysian passenger plane - was deliberately shot down.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: An Il-76 transport plane and half a dozen helicopters were brought down by pro-Russian separatists at Luhansk airport and elsewhere.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In June, separatists boasted of possessing an SA-11 Buk missile system.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They claimed to have used the system to shoot down the An-26 cargo plane at high altitude.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Separatist commander Igor Strelkov claimed to the media to have shot down another aircraft at the same time as the Malaysian Airlines flight was overflying the area.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are truly shocked by the number of victims among the civilian population in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Armed separatists, terrorists and foreign fighters and their supporters bear the responsibility for the deaths and injuries among the civilian population, including children, women and the elderly.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The carnage must end.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: President Poroshenko proposed a peace plan.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine declared a unilateral ceasefire.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The agreement in Berlin on 2 July provided a vehicle for talks.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yet separatists and terrorists in the eastern part of Ukraine continued to sow terror, loot, rob banks, racketeer, kidnap people and traffic in human beings.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The massive and continuous influx of foreign fighters from across the Russian border into the neighbouring Luhansk and Donetsk regions has gone unabated.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That influx has been accompanied by T-65 tanks, Grad multiple rocket launchers, anti-aircraft guns, towed anti-tank guns, BTR armoured personnel carriers, man-portable air defence systems and small arms.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In fact, the terrorists in Donbas hardly bothered to remove the markings of Russian military units from their heavy weapons.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian military helicopters and drones violate Ukrainian airspace, while 40,000 troops are encamped within minutes of the Ukrainian border, in addition to the 20,000 troops stationed in occupied Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russian citizens, many of whom are veterans of the conflicts in Chechnya and Transdnistria, lead many of the terrorist groups.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Russian media channels are putting out ongoing anti-Ukrainian propaganda.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The mouthpiece of the separatists, Life News, boasts of the agility of rebels to shoot down any plane in sight.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The terrorists and separatists continue to take hostages.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The abducted and hooded Ukrainian pilot Nadia Savchenko was trafficked by separatists from Ukraine straight to the Russian Voronezh pretrial detention centre.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We condemn the unlawful detention of Ukrainian citizens in Russia.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia must respect the norms of international law and release Savchenko immediately.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We remain appalled by the deteriorating human rights situation in Crimea.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Lithuania urges the holding of a full, thorough and independent investigation into the downing of the Malaysian Airlines flight, as agreed today by the Council.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Lithuania urges Russia to unequivocally distance itself from any kind of direct or indirect support for terrorists, separatists and foreign fighters.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The insurgents must lay down their weapons.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Lithuania calls on Russia to cooperate with Ukraine in order to ensure the security of the borders and to prevent weapons and armed terrorists from entering the territory of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call on Russia to constructively cooperate on the implementation of the peace plan put forward by President Petro Poroshenko.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A diplomatic solution is possible.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine's independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity within its internationally recognized borders, including Crimea, are non-negotiable and must be respected by all.
speaker: Mr. Baublys
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China is shocked and grieved by the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17 in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On behalf of the Chinese Government and people, I express our sincere condolences and deep sympathy to the victims and their families.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The safety of international civil aviation must be guaranteed.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our priority now is to establish the facts.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Pending that, it is not advisable to jump to any conclusion, make any assumptions or trade accusations.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We support the holding of an independent, fair and objective investigation into the incident.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also call on all parties to coordinate and cooperate during the investigation.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The recent situation in Ukraine remains turbulent.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Armed conflict and incidents of violence frequently occur, causing loss of life and destruction of property.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China is deeply concerned about the situation.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the parties concerned will take into account the well-being of the entire population of Ukraine, focus on maintaining regional peace and stability, stay calm and exercise restraint to prevent the further escalation of the conflict and confrontation.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The crisis in Ukraine is rooted in a complex situation that is both historical and contemporary.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A political solution is the only way out.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China notes the recent constructive efforts of the parties concerned to achieve a ceasefire through dialogue and to promote a political solution.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We hope that the parties concerned will remain committed to dialogue and negotiations, take the rights and aspirations of all regions and etnic groups of Ukraine fully into account and bear in mind the legitimate concerns of all the parties involved so that the rights of all parties can be respected in a balanced way.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge the parties concerned to effectively implement the agreed ceasefire and to strengthen dialogue and consultation on the basis of the Geneva agreement in pursuit of a political solution and the prompt achievement of stability and development in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China respects the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all countries, including Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: China will continue to adopt a fair and objective approach and actively participate in any proposal or initiative that will reduce tension and promote a political solution.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We will play a constructive role in that process.
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-l7 in Ukrainian territory on 17 July has shocked the world.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have witnessed the tragic death of298 people.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There were 28 Australians on board Flight MH-17.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our nation is in mourning for all the victims.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The news that the lives of 80 children were lost is devastating.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Tomorrow, flags will be flown at half-mast across Australia.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We extend our heartfelt sympathy and condolences to the families of all the victims of the tragedy and to their countries of nationality.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our particular thoughts are with the Governments and the people of the Netherlands and Malaysia.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is mounting evidence that the crash was caused by a missile strike and that the aeroplane was brought down over territory not controlled by the Ukrainian authorities.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There is increasing credible information that that was conducted by separatist militia groups, acting with the assistance of others.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We owe it to the victims of this tragedy and their families to unequivocally establish the facts behind the incident and to find out exactly what happened and who is responsible.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If, as appears increasingly likely, Flight MH-17 was brought down by a missile, then that is, as Australia's Prime Minister Tony Abbott has said, "an unspeakable crime", and the perpetrators must be brought swiftly to justice.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There must be a full, thorough and impartial international investigation.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his message that the United Nations is fully prepared to cooperate with any investigation and that the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) has offered its investigative capacity.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also welcome Mr. Feltman's information that ICAO and the Government of Ukraine are communicating on the issue of an investigation.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There must be immediate preservation of the crash site, and unfettered access for independent investigators.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Safe access must also be provided to allow fro the recovery of the bodies of those who lost their lives in the tragedy.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Undertakings brokered by the trilateral contact group with armed separatists who control the territory in which the crash occurred to allow access must be upheld.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our Prime Minister has made it clear that Russia's full cooperation with all investigations is expected.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Council has just issued a press statement calling for investigation, accountability and immediate access to the crash site.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is welcome, but Australia believes, given the gravity of the incident, that it is not a sufficient indication of the Council's resolve.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Australia believes the Council should adopt a draft resolution that emphasizes the need for access to be granted to the crash site and for a full, thorough, independent and international investigation to be carried out.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is the nineteenth time that the Council has met to discuss the situation in Ukraine since the crisis began.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Time and time again, the overwhelming majority of the Security Council has called for a end to the violence and destablization.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Council members have consistently called for a de-escalation of tensions, for separatists to lay down their weapons and for genuine dialogue to commence.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is time for the equivocation and dissembling and false narratives of some to stop.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the three weeks since the Council last discussed the situation in Ukraine (see S/PV.7205), the security situation in the east has become increasingly dire.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Separatists have ignored repeated calls to disarm and have continued their attacks on Ukrainian military forces, facilities and border posts.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Two Ukrainian military cargo planes were downed in eastern Ukraine in the past week alone.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian armed forces have responded firmly to those attacks.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They has every right to restore law and order, and they have underlined their commitment to do so in proportionate manner.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia has a crucial role to play in de-escalating this persistently dangerous crisis.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It must end its provocations and any support for separatist forces.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It must control its border with Ukraine and prevent the flow of weapons, equipment and fighters from Russia into Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia must withdraw the large number of troops it has again amassed on the Ukrainian border.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It must actively work to de-escalate tensions and use its considerable influence with separatist groups in Ukraine to that end.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Further political efforts are essential.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The four-party talks in Berlin in the past two weeks showed some promise.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The parties agreed on the need for a sustainable ceasefire, the resumption of the contact group, control of border crossing points monitored by the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) and an extension of the work of the OSCE observer mission to include border monitoring activities.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But we have yet to see results; those efforts must be redoubled.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We thought that the situation in Ukraine had already caused too much tragedy.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The horrific loss of Flight MH-17 has added immeasurably to that toll.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is time for the international community to stand as one to ensure that those responsible for that tragic crime are held to account and to make every effort to bring to an end the violence and destabilization in Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. King
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also thank the Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs, Mr. Jeffrey Feltman, for his briefing.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: At the start ofmy remarks, Iwish to express, on behalf of the Government and the people of Luxembourg, my most sincere condolences to the families and relatives of the 298 people aboard the Malaysia Airlines aircraft that crashed yesterday afternoon near the village of Grabovo in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Among the victims was a Dutch-English family living in Luxembourg.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our sympathy also goes out to the Governments and the peoples of the Netherlands, Malaysia, Germany, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Indonesia, New Zealand, the Philippines and the United Kingdom.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The international community owes it to the victims to shed light on the circumstances that led to this tragic event.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A transparent and independent comprehensive international investigation must be completed as soon as possible.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Safe and unhindered access must be granted to international investigators, as well as to observers from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) and representatives of affected countries.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All parties involved should fully cooperate to that end.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We commend the Ukrainian authorities in that regard.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those who committed this heinous act must be held accountable.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This air disaster took place in a context of the ongoing deterioration of the situation in the east of Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Day after day, we receive reports of civilians killed in fighting between the Ukrainian armed forces and illegal armed groups.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The pro-Russian separatist militias continue to occupy buildings and border posts, hold dozens of innocent people hostage and threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The living conditions ofpeople living in areas affected by the hostilities continue to deteriorate, and the number of internally displaced persons has steadily increased.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The escalation of violence in recent days, until its tragic climax yesterday, demonstrates once again that active armed groups in eastern Ukraine are actually well-equipped and well-trained paramilitary forces who enjoy clear external support.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We urge the Russian Federation to actively use its influence on the illegal armed groups and ensure that weapons and fighters can no longer cross the border, in order to bring about a de-escalation as soon as possible.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Throughout the past few months, Ukraine has demonstrated its commitment to finding a peaceful solution to the crisis and to implementing the agreements concluded, in particular the joint declaration adopted on 17 April in Geneva between Ukraine, Russia, the European Union and the United States.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine has established a national dialogue and guarantees for national minorities.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Once elected, President Poroshenko put forward a comprehensive peace plan and put in place a unilateral ceasefire to create the conditions necessary for its implementation.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Unfortunately, illegal armed groups, whose sole aim is to destabilize Ukraine, chose not to take that outstretched hand.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Diplomatic efforts to find a peaceful solution to the crisis in eastern Ukraine must continue.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, the personal commitment of the Secretary-General since the beginning of the crisis is essential and must continue.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is important to urgently reach an agreement on a real and lasting ceasefire that is observed by all parties, so as to create the conditions necessary for the implementation of President Poroshenko's peace plan.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We welcome the efforts made in that regard by France, Germany and the OSCE to promote dialogue between Russia and Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We sincerely hope that those efforts will contribute to a de-escalation and put an end to a crisis that has gone on for too long.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday's plane crash demonstrated the incalculable consequences that the crisis can have.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is high time for all stakeholders, including the Russian Federation, to mobilize all energies to put an end to this crisis.
speaker: Ms. Lucas
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank Mr. Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I wish to extend my deepest condolences to all the Permanent Representatives of the countries that lost citizens in this tragic event.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like in particular to extend our condolences to our colleagues from the Netherlands and Malaysia.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also mourn with the people of the Netherlands.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday a Malaysia Airlines flight with nearly 300 passengers aboard crashed in the separatist-controlled area of Ukraine, and the French President expressed his enormous sorrow at the announcement of the disaster.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text:
Today I reiterate France's solidarity with the victims'
families in the ordeal they are experiencing.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Given this tragedy and the already chaotic situation, France requests that all efforts be brought forth to shed light on the circumstances that led to the tragedy.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We call for an independent international inquiry that would allow the facts to be established and to draw the necessary conclusions.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We ask that all measures be taken to facilitate the work of the investigators on the ground.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In particular, we expect the separatists to cooperate with the Ukrainian authorities in the investigation and to allow safe, immediate and full access to the investigators, in accordance with the decision made yesterday during the video tele-conference between the contact group involving Ukraine, Russia and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) and the separatist representatives.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A glimmer of hope had begun to dawn in Ukraine at the end of last month.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With the election of Mr. Poroshenko, a process of political normalization had begun.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A unilateral ceasefire, declared by Kiev on 20 June, hinted at a possible end to the general deteriorating security and humanitarian situation in the east.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On that same day, President Poroshenko initiated a comprehensive peace plan in order to arrive at a peaceful resolution of the situation.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Furthermore, following their meeting on the sidelines of the ceremonies marking the Normandy landing, a process of almost daily exchanges between Presidents Poroshenko and Putin and Chancellor Merkel and President Hollande led to the start of a useful dialogue.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Moreover, a joint statement was adopted in Berlin on 2 July that provided for the quest of a lasting ceasefire via the meeting between the contact group and the separatists, strengthened border control on the Russian-Ukrainian border to curb the flow of weapons and fighters, and the agreement of the OSCE to participate in that effort.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Nevertheless, today the situation continues to deteriorate.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: For several days, fighting has escalated in eastern Ukraine because the separatists have refused to clasp the hand being extended to them.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Every day the attacks are ever more deadly.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Weapons never used until now have begun to be used and have struck Ukrainian territory.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Two Ukrainian planes were shot down in their own airspace.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That could happen only if one of the parties possessed sophisticated anti-aircraft weaponry.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Moreover, this unprecedented deterioration is also due to the presence of armed fighters coming from outside Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The question of outside support in terms of recruitment, supplies of materials and training cannot be avoided.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The answer is too obvious.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is irrefutable.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Weapon systems with significant firepower are being used, which can lead to tragic blunders.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those who are responsible for arming those who use those weapons bear the responsibility for this conflagration.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As I said in an earlier statement, when bandits are given weapons we cannot be surprised that they behave like bandits.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All those events point to the pressing need for full cooperation by the international community in order to stabilize Ukraine and ensure its sovereignty and territorial integrity.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also call for a sincere commitment from Russia, one that so far has been lacking.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The day before yesterday, the Heads of State and Government of the European Union acknowledged that the many appeals made to Moscow to end its non-cooperative stance had not been heard.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is the reason for the European Union's decision to impose tougher sanctions.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, the strengthening of those sanctions has one and the same goal: to facilitate the emergence of a political solution.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our priority remains, first, to end the escalation and establish a lasting ceasefire that is respected by all parties.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That is why we call on Russia to engage constructively in that endeavour and to bring its influence to bear on the illegal armed groups to lay down their arms and engage in dialogue.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Separatist activity must end.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In order to slow down the flow of weapons and fighters that cross through the Russian-Ukrainian border on a daily basis, we call for negotiations between Ukraine, Russia and the OSCE in order to allow the rapid deployment of a monitoring mission at the border.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let this tragedy at least serve as a warning to all the parties.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Once the bullets have been shot, they strike indiscriminately and escape all control.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have reached such moment.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It should still be possible to avoid the worst.
speaker: Mr. Araud
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank Mr. Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing on the latest events in Ukraine and for expressing the constant willingness of the Secretary-General to contribute to peace and dialogue.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Government and the people of Argentina express their profound sadness, pain, solidarity and deepest condolences to the families of the victims of yesterday's tragic Malaysia Airlines crash.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We also express our condolences to the people and the Government of Ukraine and to the Governments and the peoples of the other countries whose citizens lost their lives.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In particular, we ask that our colleagues among the Permanent Representatives of the countries whose citizens were aboard that flight convey our condolences to the families, especially to those who saw the hopes for their children's futures extinguished.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The severity of this event clearly demands action.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Like our colleagues, Argentina calls for an impartial international investigation that objectively and unequivocally establishes what happened.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Responsibility and the facts must be determined as soon as possible, and investigators must be granted immediate, unhindered access.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Although it is not today's topic, I should like to say that, while there had been encouraging indications that the crisis in Ukraine was entering a phase of waning tension, fears that violent confrontation would continue have not dissipated.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine
