sentence_text: But the topic today does involve calling once again for the armed groups to cease their violence and demanding that they halt unilateral actions and their violations and trampling of human rights, which do nothing but deepen the crisis and worsen the situation, especially for the civilian population and for the innocent.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We reiterate the need to safeguard due respect for Ukraine's conduct of its internal affairs without interference - whether military, political or economic 4 in matters under its jurisdiction.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Argentina seeks to promote full respect by everyone for the principles of international law and human rights law as enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: These are sad and difficult times.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Argentina therefore calls for prudence.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We will not join in using the language of geopolitical disputes.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We will not join in a pointless blame game.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This is a time for sorrow, reflection and an urgent search for the truth behind the incident to determine those responsible.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: May the victims rest in peace.
speaker: Mrs. Perceval
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I first want to say to our colleagues whose citizens were involved that we convey our deepest condolences to their families, citizens and Governments.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday at noon, the world watched in horror the downing of the Malaysian jetliner.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What happened yesterday seemed to be an apocalyptic end to the world.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I think Ambassador Power described it similarly.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The spectacle is graphically described, respectively, in chapters 8 and 9 of the Book of Revelation: "hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the Earth", "the sun and the air were darkened".
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That was what I saw yesterday.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: No matter our religious beliefs, that scenario may become a self-fulfilling prophesy if States continue to choose to open or support theatres of war and conflict in every corner of the world.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: What will happen is that the world will self-annihilate.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Enough is enough.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The fact that this incident occurred as the plane flew over eastern Ukraine, which, for some time now, has been a zone of conflict, indicates that the accident may be connected, in one way or another, to the conflict.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But this is not the time to play the blame game.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If it is established that the plane was shot down deliberately, it will mark a new dimension in the Ukraine crisis, one that represents a grave threat to the safety of international civil aviation.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: At this point, it is of critical importance for the facts surrounding the crash to be dispassionately well-ascertained.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, we would like to express our full support for an independent international investigation, as called for by the Secretary-General.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Noting that the plane went down in an area under the control of armed rebel groups, we urge that those groups cooperate fully and unconditionally with the investigation into the crash.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have no doubt that, without the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and the widespread insecurity and lawlessness engendered by the activities of the rebel groups in the eastern part of the country, this tragic accident would not have occurred.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We want to renew our call for a cessation of hostilities in Ukraine and a return to dialogue and negotiation, within the framework of the Geneva statement of 17 April and the 2 July four-party talks in Berlin.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us together resolve this issue.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Let us together close this war front, before its reverberations become manifest in other parts of the world.
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: First, we would like to express our heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families and friends of the passengers and crew of the Malaysia Airlines flight that crashed in Donetsk, as well as to the Governments of the countries whose citizens were on the list of victims of the tragedy.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: An open and impartial investigation of the incident is necessary.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There must be no pressure placed on the investigation, or attempts to prejudge its outcome through broad statements or unfounded allegations.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Given the complexity of the situation, we believe it would be proper to establish an international commission under the aegis of International Civil Aviation Organization.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am certain that any normal person would, first and foremost, ask the question as to what led a Ukrainian aviation dispatcher to send a passenger flight through an area of military clashes - an area being used to carry out strikes against civilian targets, among others, and where anti-aircraft systems were operating.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In line with international standards, ensuring the security of civilian aviation in a State's airspace is that State's responsibility.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The State over whose territory a flight is planned must provide the information necessary to ensure the safety of aviation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: International law provides for a State's timely ability to close off areas deemed dangerous for flights.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It would seem that an investigation is necessary not only of the disaster, but also of the extent to which Ukrainian aviation authorities carried out their obligations to exercise the relevant law and did everything necessary to ensure that Kyiv's military campaign prevented disasters.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today Kyiv announced the full closure of its airspace to conduct a so-called anti-terrorist operation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Why could that not have been done earlier, instead of waiting for there to be hundreds of victims?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: During our previous meeting on Ukraine (see S/PV.7205), some Western members of the Council talked about the restraint exercised by the Kyiv authorities in using force.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They have fully demonstrated that "restraint" now.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There have been indiscriminate air strikes, rocket fire and attacks by artillery tanks in Donetsk and Luhansk.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This punitive operation is becoming increasingly destructive for the civilian population and infrastructure.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Dozens of civilians have been killed, including children.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Transport systems, community facilities and medical centres have been destroyed.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: According to data of the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), there are more than 4.5 million people in eastern Ukraine in the area of the clashes.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, Kyiv has not evacuated civilians from those areas.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Instead, people must risk their lives to flee the areas of military clashes by themselves.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There are many reports of people being intentionally targeted by the Ukrainian armed forces as they flee the war, in particular to seek refuge in Russia.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To date, Russia has hosted more than 110,000 refugees from eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That figure continues to grow daily.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those facts have been confirmed by UNCHR.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, six Russian regions have declared a state of emergency.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Artillery and mortar shelling by the Ukrainian armed forces into Russian territory has become a regular occurrence.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The targets include border crossing points and peaceful civilians.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our citizens have been killed and wounded.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We consider those provocations acts of aggression on the part of Ukraine against Russian citizens and against its sovereign territory.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We place all blame on the Kyiv authorities and call for the Ukrainian side to take decisive measures to prevent such incidents in future.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have repeatedly issued warnings about the danger of trying to resolve the political crisis in Ukraine by force.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We called for a mutually respectful and inclusive dialogue among all major political forces, Kyiv and the regions.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: However, the Kyiv authorities have chosen the wrong the path at every turn, with the support of its Western colleagues.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I am talking about the United States, of course, which pushed Kyiv to escalate the crisis.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They are trying to lay the blame on Russia for the catastrophe caused by the course chosen.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Kyiv cast aside the agreement of 21 February and the road map proposed by the Chair of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Geneva statement of 17 April and the Berlin declaration of 2 July were also dismissed, although representatives from the Kyiv Government took part in drafting them.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The widely acclaimed peace plan of President Poroshenko became the pretext for military preparations and the deployment of a large-scale punitive operation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Kyiv authorities have chosen to suppress dissent.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Immediately after the February uprising, Kyiv began to call dissenters "bandits" and "terrorists", and then "subhumans" and "insects".
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Was it fortuitous that on Channel 5, the Ukrainian television channel owned by Mr. Poroshenko, a commercial was aired showing the stamping out of insects with a map of eastern Ukraine in the background?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Protesters have been massacred in Mariupol and Odesa.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The number of victims continues to rise and no genuine investigation has been carried out.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Dozens of people who politically opposed Kyiv have disappeared.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The promised reform of the Constitution is being prepared in secret.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It appears that Kyiv would like to enlist the support of European structures and then give it to its lucky people.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indeed, according to reports, the redistribution of powers from the President to the Parliament, which was the source of the fighting in Maidan for months, is not actually being planned for.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Is it any wonder that violence has been the result of such strategy?
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The political representatives of those regions are well known.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They have long been a part okaraine's political life, and have come to the forefront through the protest movements in recent months.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Involving them in the dialogue would prevent a further escalation of the current serious crisis, but instead Kyiv chose to arrest, beat and threaten them.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With regard to the Ukrainian crisis, international institutions have not risen to the occasion.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The reason lies with our Western partners.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Much has been said, but nothing has been done to resolve the situation.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are working hard in the OSCE.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the Security Council, the Russian delegation proposed three times the serious drafting of a resolution that would put an end to the violence in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: But Western colleagues responded to our proposals with blatant cynicism.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It seems that whatever the Ukrainian Government arbitrarily does is judged favourably, but the victims of the geopolitical ambitions of the Ukrainian regime are actually an entire nation - the people of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The punitive operation in eastern Ukraine must be stopped immediately.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Negotiating a resolution to the crisis is still possible, but the right choice must be made.
speaker: Mr. Churkin
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing on the tragic incident in Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Republic of Korea expresses its utmost shock and outrage at the downing of the Malaysia Airlines passenger plane in eastern Ukraine yesterday.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We deplore the loss of nearly 300 innocent civilian lives aboard that commercial airliner.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On behalf of the people and the Government of the Republic of Korea, I extend my deepest condolences to the people and Governments of Australia, Belgium, Canada, Germany, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Netherlands, the Philippines and the United Kingdom and other affected countries.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our hearts go out to the families of the victims at this difficult time.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A thorough and independent international investigation, involving, among others, the International Civil Aviation Organization, must be conducted immediately.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Whoever is responsible for the tragedy must be held fully accountable.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If this incident turns out to have been caused by a deliberate attack, the Republic of Korea, itself a former victim of hostilities against a civilian airlines, believes that the international community should do everything in its power to bring the perpetrators to justice as quickly as possible.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: No one should be allowed, for any reason, to get away with killing so many innocent people, who had nothing to do with what is happening on the ground.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We support the ongoing efforts to bring stability to Ukraine, in particular the efforts of the United Nations, the European Union, the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and bilateral partners.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Such efforts, aimed at de-escalating the violence in eastern Ukraine, should continue despite the daunting challenges.
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I shall now make a statement in my capacity as the representative of Rwanda.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank Mr. Jeffrey Feltman, Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs, for his availability and for his detailed briefing, prepared on such short notice.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Allow me, first of all, to express my deep sorrow over the loss of the 298 lives, including 80 children, who were killed on Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-l7, which was shot down in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On behalf of the Government of Rwanda, I express my deepest condolences to the families who lost loved ones, as well as to the people and the Governments of the victims.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The loss of those innocent civilians is beyond comprehension.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Their lives were cut off in the middle of a crisis on which this very Council has been unable to take action since it began in February.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: With the shooting down of a civilian airplane carrying civilians, the Ukrainian crisis is no longer a conflict between the Ukrainian military and armed separatists.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The conflict has crossed a red line by endangering all our lives, as if did in the case of the men, women and children from different countries who were aboard Flight MH-l7.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We condemn in the strongest terms this reckless attack and call for a comprehensive, independent, international investigation in accordance with international guidelines, as agreed in the press statement adopted this morning.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Such an investigaton should establish responsibility so that the perpetrators can be held accountable.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that context, we further urge all parties to cease fire, to fully cooperate with the investigation and to grant unhindered access to the crash site in order to allow international investigators to carry out their work.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We note that yesterday's criminal act follows the downing of a Ukrainian fighter jet on Wednesday and that of a military cargo plane on Monday.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The frequent use of surface-to-air missiles during the past few months raises the question of access to such weapons, which, as we have now seen, are capable of downing a civilian airplane flying at over 30,000 feet.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Therefore, the Security Council and the broader international community can no longer afford to turn a blind eye on the matter.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is unfortunate that this tragic event comes at a time when national and regional efforts are under way to find a political and diplomatic solution to the Ukrainian crisis.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This act undermines valuable initiatives of the trilateral contact group of senior representatives of Ukraine, the Russian Federation and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, who were making all necessary efforts for a resumption of consultations with separatists in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On Tuesday, the group reconfirmed its support for President Petro Poroshenko's peace plan, as well as its commitment to a sustainable ceasefire, as stated in the joint declaration issued in Berlin on 2 July by the Foreign Ministers of Germany, France, the Russian Federation and Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In conclusion, let me renew our call to the armed groups to respect the unity, sovereignty and territorial integrity okaraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They must lay down their weapons and engage in constructive dialogue with the Ukrainian Government.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In the same vein, we urge all parties to immediately cease fire and support the ongoing efforts to de-escalate the crisis and bring peace to Ukraine and the region.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The shooting down of a civilian plane in the midst of the conflict in eastern Ukraine is a stark reminder of the moral responsibility of Security Council members to set aside their divisions on this crisis, to hold the perpetrators of this criminal act to account and to uphold their mandate to maintain international peace and security.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The President: I now resume my functions as President of the Council.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I give the floor to the representative of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Gasana
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank you, Mr. President, for convening this meeting.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I also thank Under-Secretary-General Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to start by expressing my Government's sorrow and deep condolences to all the Missions whose citizens were killed in the terrible crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine shares the pain of their loss and grieves with their bereaved families and friends.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: My country extends its profound sympathy to those affected by the accident.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today, all of Ukraine is mourning.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukrainians are visiting the Embassies of the Netherlands, Malaysia, Australia, Indonesia, the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium, the Philippines and Canada in order to leave flowers and express their sorrow.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian authorities have already called on international organizations, including the International Civil Aviation Organization, Interpol and others, to undertake a thorough international investigation of the accident.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We believe that an impartial investigation will reveal the truth and that all perpetrators will be punished.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday, the Ukrainian leadership announced a basic version of what happened with the flight: it was an act of terror.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The position of our Government is based on converging data from different intelligence and open sources, which show that the aircraft was shot down over territory controlled by terrorists.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Two Ukrainian jets were shot down near the same location several days before, with terrorist leaders claiming responsibility for those acts.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Intercepted telephone conversations between the terrorist leaders and their coordinator - Russian military intelligence colonel Vasili Geranin - confirm that terrorists are behind this crime.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That conversation was recorded, and the Secretariat has promised to convey it to members of the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Immediately after the crash, the military leader of the terrorists, Igor Girkin Strelkov, who is of Russian origin, boasting on social networks, commented on having shot down what he believed to be a Ukrainian jet, saying the following.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: "In Torez, Ukraine, an AN-26 has been shot down.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It is lying somewhere near the Progress coal mine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have warned everyone not to fly in our skies".
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: To target and shoot down an aeroplane at an altitude of as high as 10 kilometres would be possible only by using a sophisticated anti-aircraft system, such as the SA-ll Buk missile system, or a similar system.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: It has been affirmed both by the radio interception of terrorist leaders and by photographs and video-recordings obtained from citizens of cities in the area, that the terrorists have at least two SA-ll Buk missile systems.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The question is, where did they get those sophisticated anti-defence systems?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I reiterate that radio interceptions, photographs and the confessions of detained terrorists, including two recently detained Russian citizens who were going to join the terrorists as military experts, state that the Buk system came from Russia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All that and other evidence and information will be provided to the international investigation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: This tragedy would not have been possible if Russia had not supported the terrorists and if a sophisticated anti-aircraft system had not been provided to them from Russia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On many occasions, the Ukrainian Mission to the United Nations has addressed the Security Council and all States Members of the United Nations and has given them information about Russia's support for the terrorists in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Only yesterday, we presented new evidence to United Nations-accredited media.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The huge supply of weapons of Russian origin being used by terrorists in Donbas, which has been documented by the Ukrainian intelligence agencies, the media and the general public, is no longer a secret to anyone.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A large exhibition of confiscated modern weapons, seized by the Ukrainian military forces from terrorist groups, took place in Kyiv a few days ago.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In most cases, the actual military units of the Russian armed forces are specified as the origin of those weapons.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The documentation can be accessed on the website of the Ukrainian Mission and from my press conference yesterday, which can be found on the United Nations website.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We have raised our concern several times here in the Chamber that Russian nationals are directly participating in destabilizing the situation in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Some colleagues have today given some information about the Luhansk and Donetsk leaders proclaiming republics.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All their military commanders are of Russian origin.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Illegal armed groups of fighters are stepping up their recruitment efforts within Russia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They seek volunteers with experience in operating heavy weapons, such as tanks and air defence equipment.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Russia has allowed the establishment of recruitment offices in Moscow and Rostov, which are openly recruiting and sending Russian nationals to Ukraine's eastern regions.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Yesterday at the press conference, we described all the websites that are calling for recruits.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Numerous groups of Russian paramilitary formations, including Russian Cossacks, are actively supporting the terrorists in spreading terror and chaos in the eastern part of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Throughout the entire period of such articifically created confrontations, supported by Russia, that country has never publically called on its citizens to refrain from joining the illegal armed groups operating on the territory of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That fact speaks for itself.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Paragraph 2 of article 208 of the criminal code of the Russian Federation states the following.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: "Participation in armed groups that are not governed by federal law, as well as participation in such armed groups on the territory of a foreign State for any purpose against the interests of the Russian Federation, is punishable by 5 to 10 years' imprisonment".
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Since no Russian national has been brought to justice for such actions, there is only one conclusion: their participation in illegal armed groups on the territory of Ukraine does not contradict the interests of the Russian Federation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The situation on the Ukrainian-Russian State border has significantly deteriorated in recent days as a result of systematic violations coming from the Russian side of the border, as well as the provocative actions of armed terrorist groups in the border areas of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Several times a day, columns of military vehicles and Russian mercenaries attempt to break through the Ukrainian State border from the Russian side.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Such attempts are actively facilitated by Russian border protection units.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The anti-terrorist forces in Ukraine have been repeatedly shelled from the territory of Russia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine has documented evidence of all those facts for the appropriate international response.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The number of provocations on the Ukrainian-Russian State border has increased substantially.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Illegal armed groups systematically fire towards the territory of Russia in order to create the false image of Ukrainian military fire.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: That caused the death of a Russian citizen.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Russian side accused the armed forces of Ukraine of shelling on Russian territory on 28 June, namely, Mine No. 24 of Vasetskaya village in the Krasnosulynsky district of the Rostov region and the Gukovo border checkpoint.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: The Ukrainian armed forces have never attacked or fired on the territory of Russia.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: All such provocations are committed by pro-Russian terrorists in order to find grounds for a further escalation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today's statement by the Russian Foreign Minister, Sergey Lavrov, about the possibility of carrying out strikes against the territory of Ukraine sounds like a new provocation.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Today, colleagues have presented some evidence of the deteriorating situation on the Ukrainian-Russian border.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Every day during the month of July, we have observed such violations, including the shooting-down of Ukrainian jets.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to take this opportunity to once again draw the attention of members of the Security Council to the fact that Russia continues to redeploy new forces extremely close to the Ukrainian border.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As of 14 July, the total number of groups of Russian armed forces in the areas bordering Ukraine has significantly increased.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: They comprise 33 battalion tactical groups, with a total of at least 40,000 troops directly around Ukraine, including up to 18,000 troops in Transnistria and up to 21,000 troops in the occupied territory ofCrimea.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those and similar actions constitute a flagrant violation by Russia of its obligations under the Charter of the United Nations and other universally recognized principles and norms of international law.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Those actions are incompatible with the obligations of the Russian Federation under the Geneva agreement of 17 April and the Berlin declaration of2 June.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Despite all the international efforts, supported by the strong Ukrainian will to prevent a further escalation and further strengthened by the President's peace plan, the foreign terrorists and their Russian supporters have no intention of leaving us in peace or laying down their arms.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We are still struggling against high-capacity military saboteurs who are willing to destroy Ukraine and to establish havens for chaos and instability.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Ukraine demands that the Russian side immediately cease provocations on the State border of Ukraine, stop hindering the efforts of the Ukrainian side and the international community to put an end to terrorism and other violence in Donetsk and Luhansk regions, return to President Poroshenko's peace plan, withdraw its forces from the Ukrainian border and stop threatening peace and security in our country, the region and the world as a whole.
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I thank the President for convening today's meeting.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As a matter of priority, on behalf of the Government and the people of Indonesia, I wish to express our deepest condolences to all affected nations, especially our good neighbour Malaysia, over the deaths of the 298 civilian passengers and crew aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17, which crashed yesterday as it was flying over eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As the Council may be aware, 12 Indonesian citizens were confirmed among the deceased.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our thoughts and prayers are with the families of the victims.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Allow me also to take this opportunity to sincerely thank the delegations that have expressed their sympathy and condolences to Indonesia.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: According to various sources and reports, the airplane was presumably shot down by a surface-to-air missile.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If that is indeed the case, such a heinous act is tantamount to a grave violation of international law, in particular international humanitarian law.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, Indonesia calls upon the Security Council to take immediate steps to enable a thorough, transparent and independent international investigation to be conducted upon this horrendous incident.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Indonesia stands ready to join and support such an investigation.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: If the investigation concludes that the crash was indeed intentionally caused by human factors, be it a missile strike or otherwise, Indonesia demands that the perpetrators of such a heinous and inhuman crime be brought to justice to the fullest extent of the law.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: As a precautionary measure, yesterday my President instructed all Indonesian airlines to exercise the utmost caution and to avoid the airspace in and around conflict areas, including that of Ukraine.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In conclusion, as a member of the Association of Southeast Ansian Nations family, Indonesia reiterates its solidarity with the Government and the people of Malaysia, as well as with the countries whose citizens have fallen victim to this tragedy.
speaker: Mr. Percaya
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would like to thank you, Mr. President, for giving me the opportunity to participate in this meeting.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: I would also like to thank Under-Secretary-General Feltman for his briefing.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: On behalf of the Government and the people of Belgium, I would like first to express my most heartfelt condolences to the Government of Malaysia, as well as to the families and friends of the 298 people who were aboard the Malaysia Airlines plane shot down in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: There were five Belgian nationals among the victims.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Our thoughts are with those who mourn today, in particular the friends and families and the Government of the Netherlands, a country close to us.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Like others who preceded me have done, Belgium launches an appeal to all the parties to guarantee full access to the disaster site, not only for the search and rescue teams but also for the investigators.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: A full, detailed, thorough and impartial international investigation should be conducted to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the MH-17 disaster.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: In that regard, Belgium supports the proposal of Australia that the Security Council adopt a draft resolution that stresses the need for guaranteed access to the site and for the conduct of a full, independent international investigation.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: We owe it to the victims and their families, as well as to ourselves, to shed full light on what happened yesterday in eastern Ukraine.
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
Subject: Ukraine

sentence_text: Egypt is proposing an amendment to paragraph 2 of the draft resolution (8/2016/235) that has been submitted to the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is the paragraph that details the conditions under which a contingent would be repatriated in the case of an allegation of sexual exploitation and abuse.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The amendment consists of a slight modification to the language in the paragraph, to be put to a separate vote.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The original language proposed by the United States delegation would allow taking arbitrary and unobjective decisions amounting to collective punishment against hundreds ofpeacekeeping personnel.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That would undoubtedly have severe and negative impacts on the morale of personnel and tarnish the reputation of troop-contributing countries.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Our proposed amendment is aimed at addressing that loophole in the draft resolution by specifying the conditions that would have to be met in order to take action with regard to an entire contingent.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Those three conditions are: a failure by the troop-contributing country to investigate allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse; a failure by the troop-contributing country to punish those guilty of sexual exploitation and abuse; and a failure by the troop-contributing country to inform the Secretary-General of the measures taken against those who commit acts of sexual exploitation and abuse.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The United States will vote against the proposed amendment put forward by Egypt for a simple, stark reason, that is, the amendment would undermine the purpose of the draft resolution (8/2016/235).
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Our draft resolution does not dictate how any Member State should go about investigating allegations or punishing those perpetrators found within their own systems to be guilty.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: But it does clearly state - finally - that there would be real consequences if the concerned troop- or police-contributing country failed to credibly respond to the allegations against its personnel.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Under the draft resolution, a non-response is simply not an option.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Our draft resolution outlines broad, objective criteria for troop- and police-contributing countries to satisfy, as appropriate, in the event that their personnel are the subject of an allegation or allegations.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Those criteria relate to countries not taking any of the following steps, namely, not investigating an allegation or allegations, not holding accountable somebody who has been found to be a perpetrator, or not informing the Secretary-General of the actions that the State has undertaken.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: In the draft resolution, which will come up for a vote shortly, the failure to do any one of those things should trigger the replacement provision set out in paragraph 2 of the draft resolution owing to non-response.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Please hear me out on this issue: by merely inserting a very simple word - one of the most often-used words in the English language, "and" - the amendment proposed by Egypt stipulates that all three conditions must be met prior to triggering that provision.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: For example, under the Egyptian provision, if a country merely sends a letter to the Secretary-General, after receiving an allegation or allegations, that it has chosen not to investigate, giving no reason, but informing the Secretary-General according to that provision, and if it does nothing else, it would be in compliance with the draft resolution as amended by Egypt.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That would be enough.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: If a Member State investigated and determined that an individual committed an act of sexual abuse and exploitation but does not hold the perpetrator accountable, it would actually be in compliance with the draft resolution as Egypt would have it amended.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Withthe proposedEgyptian amendment, there would be no cost either for non-response or for uninvestigated, unaccountable criminal behaviour.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That undermines the purpose of today's draft resolution, which is to get countries to respond to credible allegations against their personnel and to change a system that is not working.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It is to move away from talking about zero tolerance to actually having a provision that puts in place consequences that incentivize the kinds of actions that every member of the Security Council, including Egypt, has said it supports.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: For that reason, we will vote against the proposed Egyptian amendment.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: As a Council, we often demand that perpetrators be held accountable, and no one has said before that the Council is acting in contravention of the presumption of innocence.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That is not what we are doing.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: In that regard, again, Member States will have the authority within their own systems to determine how to pursue an investigation, whether a guilty finding is appropriate and what will be the means of accountability that they put in place.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: But it cannot be the case that simply sending a note to the Secretary-General after allegations of such gravity are brought is enough to dispense with a State's obligations under the draft resolution.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: My last point is that we in the United States are vehemently opposed to collective punishment.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I think that everyone on the Council is totally united on that.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We oppose the stigma that is placed on whole units serving honourably when single individuals are alleged to have committed crimes of the magnitude we are talking about.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: But what is causing collective punishment, collective guilt and stigmas - not just for a unit, but for the United Nations as a whole and for its missions - is the failure to establish individual responsibility.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The collective gets the blame when the individual is not held accountable, and Egypt's proposed amendment would make it less likely that we would see individual responsibility.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: At the outset, I would like to express my unequivocal condemnation of all crimes of sexual exploitation and abuse and to emphasize that States must take all the measures necessary to combat and eradicate such crimes as a deterrent to potential offenders.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I would also like to stress how important it is that every effort be made to assist the victims of such crimes, in line with the compliance of Egypt and every other State Member of the United Nations with our zero-tolerance policy.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The Egyptian delegation chose not to vote against today's resolution 2272 (2016) out of our sincere belief in the importance of many of its provisions, which are designed to deal with repeated cases of sexual exploitation and abuse in peacekeeping operations.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Despite the unilateral approach to the negotiations on the draft resolution, we have chosen not to vote against it.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Throughout the negotiations and during yesterday's briefing on the subject (see S/PV.7642), my delegation has consistently pointed to the need to differentiate between, on the one hand, condemning and combating sexual exploitation and abuse and, on the other, tarring entire States and the troops they contribute with the same brush.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The way that peacekeeping troops and troop-contributing countries (TCCs) have been libelled is completely unacceptable.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It has a drastic and negative effect on the troops' morale and demonstrates contempt for the sacrifices of tens of thousands of peacekeeping personnel operating under extremely difficult conditions.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The Security Council has chosen to act on an issue outside its purview, since conduct and discipline, including in relation to sexual exploitation and abuse, are matters that are at the very core of the competence of the General Assembly.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: All States Members of the United Nations are represented in the General Assembly, including the TCCs.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Therefore, taking action on this matter in the Security Council rather than in the General Assembly illustrates ulterior motives aimed at capitalizing on the fact the major troop-contributing countries are absent from this organ, in order to adopt a resolution that never would have been adopted in the organ designated with responsibility to confront sexual abuse and exploitation.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It would have been more appropriate if United Nations bodies had focused on addressing the root causes of the problem by providing sufficient predeployment training to peacekeeping forces, ensuring the separation of United Nations camps from the local population, avoiding prolonged rotation and providing adequate living conditions, among other things.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The Security Council resolution could give some the impression that sexual exploitation and abuse are being used to bring pressure to bear on TCCs in response to their legitimate demands regarding improving the conditions of troops and their efforts to contribute more effectively to establishing peacekeeping operations and drafting the mandates of operations in partnership with the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The United Kingdom welcomes the adoption of resolution 2272 (2016) today.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I pay tribute to Samantha for her determination and courage in bringing this difficult issue to the Security Council.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Like so many in the chamber yesterday, I was appalled by the sickening crimes detailed in our meeting (see S/PV.7642) on the report of the Secretary-General (S/2016/729).
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Alhough I was shocked, sadly I cannot say that I was surprised.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Horrific allegations against peacekeepers have surfaced almost every year for over two decades - in Bosnia and Herzegovina, in C6te d'Ivoire, in Haiti, in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and now inthe Central African Republic.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The most harrowing abuse demands the most steadfast response.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Each and every victim could tell us that for too long our response has fallen short.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Today I hope that finally we have turned the page and begun to make amends.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We cannot be having this discussion again - not in 20 years' time, not in one year's time.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: What we need now is swift and systematic implementation of this resolution, implementation that brings justice for the victims and ends the sickening cycle of impunity.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is not about collective punishment, nor about penalizing the many for the sick acts of the few.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is about taking serious action in the face of serious allegations, about acting decisively against any pattern of abuse in any part of the world.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It is deeply regrettable that there was no unanimity and that there was an attempt to weaken the resolution through a draft amendment.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: What does that say to the victims, the women and girls whom we heard so poignantly about yesterday, that some members of this Council would seek to weaken our response, rather than endorse meaningful action?
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The United Kingdom voted against the draft amendment because not holding perpetrators accountable is unacceptable.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Had the draft amendment succeeded, the Secretary-General would not have had a lever to apply pressure for accountability.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I want to conclude with the words of a teenage girl from Bangui.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Speaking to ajournalist earlier this year, she said: "Sometimes when I am alone with my baby I think about killing him.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: He reminds me of the man who raped me."
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text:
(The Washington Post, 
27 February 2016)
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Those are difficult words to read in the Council, but this is the reality of sexual exploitation and abuse.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It is a reality created by a peacekeeper who was entrusted to help, not harm, that teenage girl.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It is a reality that we simply cannot shy away from.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We must confront it and we must end it.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This resolution today is a vital step towards doing so.
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Russia backed the adoption of resolution 2272 (2016), on sexual exploitation and abuse in peacekeeping operations.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We approached with understanding the initiative of the United States and other States' delegations to send a signal through the Security Council regarding the unacceptability of such actions.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We decisively condemn such crimes and deem it necessary to strengthen peacekeepers' responsibility for sexual exploitation and abuse.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: During the course of intensive negotiations, we were able to craft a text that expanded preventive measures and the fight against this phenomenon, not only to the United Nations but also other missions deployed with Security Council consent.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: However, we believe it is important to underscore once again that we cannot accept attempts to exclude national peacekeeping contingents enjoying the Security Council's mandate from responsibility for the commission of sexual exploitation and abuse.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is all the more true as recently there has been a significant number of cases that clearly point to the fact that such crimes were committed byjust such contingents of foreign missions.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: At a time when the majority of United Nations contingents that are focused on in this resolution are represented by countries ofAsia and Africa, it seems the military personnel of Western countries would like to enjoy immunity from prosecution for such actions.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is fraught with the risk of undermining the effectiveness of actions undertaken to fight this evil and could also have an impact on the standing of the international Organization.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It could also become a time bomb for the peacekeeping work of the United Nations.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Russia hopes that the Secretary-General will use the authority he possesses pursuant to this resolution to ensure that there is transparent and objective investigation of existing cases and the punishment of the guilty in all cases, without exception, regardless of the country of nationality of the perpetrator.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We view the adoption by the Security Council of the resolution today as an exception to the rule.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We continue to believe that the issue of the discipline of peacekeepers is not related to the maintenance of international peace and security.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: For many years these problems have been discussed in various bodies of the General Assembly - for example, the Secretary-General submits his relevant reports to the General Assembly.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We strongly support the continuation of this established practice, which has proven to be effective.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We would like to underscore that we are concerned by the fact that the sponsors of the resolution ignored the logical and wise amendments that were proposed by Egypt and were backed by troop-contributing countries (TCCs).
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is a case in which the view of the troop-contributing countries must be heard and must be included in the work on Security Council resolutions.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We believe it is wrong to pit the Council up against the General Assembly and, even worse, against TCCs.
speaker: Mr. Iliichev
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: United Nations peacekeeping operations have made great contributions to the maintenance of international peace and security, but a very small number of peacekeepers are suspected of acts of sexual exploitation and abuse, acts that undermine the image and the reputation of United Nations peacekeeping operations and the United Nations as a whole.
speaker: Mr. Shen Bo
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: China supports Secretary-General Ban ki-Moon and the Secretariat in adopting the zero-tolerance policy, supports the international community in taking comprehensive response measures and supports the Council in playing a proper role in this regard, including stepping up coordination with the General Assembly and other United Nations bodies.
speaker: Mr. Shen Bo
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: China therefore voted in favour of resolution 2272 (2016).
speaker: Mr. Shen Bo
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The sexual exploitation and abuse problem involves troop-contributing countries.
speaker: Mr. Shen Bo
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The Council should fully hear and heed the views of the troop-contributing countries.
speaker: Mr. Shen Bo
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We believe that the Security Council should have had ample time for further consultation to maximize our efforts to seek agreement and forge consensus to the largest extent possible.
speaker: Mr. Shen Bo
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: France voted in favour ofresolution 2272 (2016), prepared by the United States Mission, a resolution that strengthens the fight against sexual abuse in peacekeeping operations.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We believe that the fight against sexual abuse is an absolute imperative, both moral and political, and deserves the Council's full attention as an interlinked complement to the work undertaken by the General Assembly on these issues.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: At stake are not only our most fundamental values but also the reputation and effectiveness of peacekeeping operations personnel.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Sexual abuse cannot and should no longer be treated as a simple disciplinary or behavioural problem and tackled at the administrative level.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The United Nations had to provide a political and operational response to the allegations made and confirmed cases by providing clear guidelines to commanders and troops deployed on the ground.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The goal is to strengthen the fight against sexual abuse not only within peacekeeping operations but also when committed by forces that are not under the command of the United Nations but contribute to such operations.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Unfortunately, today peacekeeping operations account for 70 per cent of the allegations of sexual abuse within the United Nations system.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: At a time when the Secretary-General is undertaking determined action, the Council's support is indispensable.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Let us recall once again that sexual abuse is unacceptable, regardless of the perpetrator or source of these actions - military, police, civilian personnel, United Nations or non-United Nations.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The colour of the helmet or uniform means little to the victims.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The resolution allows us to send a clear message to all actors: Blue Helmets, police, civilian personnel and international forces.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We must do our utmost to translate into reality the zero-tolerance objective, which must serve more than ever before as our compass and our shared obligation.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: France, which contributes to peacekeeping operations, has consistently during the negotiation process supported this broad-based approach, which sends a strong message to all players.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I should note, however, that we do not intend here to collectively stigmatize the soldiers who bravely fight for our Organization's ideals; that is not, and will never be, our intention.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This issue is too important for us not to all mobilize in a collective spirit of goodwill.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Everyone must feel heeded.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This is why an in-depth, inclusive dialogue with the troop-contributing countries is so important, for the sake of efficiency, in order to achieve the result that we all wish to see.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It is vital for everyone to take ownership of the zero-tolerance objective to which I have just referred.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We must meet this challenge.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Our collective action will serve as the best possible reply to the Secretary-General's call and, ofcourse, to the victims.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Rest assured that France's determination in this respect is absolute, both nationally and in the framework of the United Nations.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: France will spare no effort in supporting the Secretary-General's efforts aimed at strengthening our policy of zero tolerance for sexual abuse.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I should like to conclude by once again paying heartfelt tribute to all of the soldiers who are working for the maintenance of peace and to their invaluable contribution.
speaker: Mr. Delattre
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: On behalf of the United States, I should like sincerely to thank those countries that voted in favour of resolution 2272 (2016), which was adopted today.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The resolution underscores the Security Council's responsibility - our responsibility - to address the scourge of sexual exploitation and abuse in United Nations peacekeeping, which has been allowed to persist for far too long.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Impunity for such abuses clearly undermines our efforts to promote international peace and security.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The resolution makes clear that it is our job to ensure that there is accountability when men, women and children are abused by the Blue Helmets whom the Council has sent to protect them.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The resolution signals the Security Council's strong support for the zero-tolerance policy of the United Nations and for the ongoing efforts by the Secretary-General to strengthen this institution's response, reporting and remedial measures to prevent and combat sexual exploitation and abuse among United Nations peacekeepers.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The resolution underscores the fact that peacekeepers found guilty - not those accused, those found guilty - of committing sexual exploitation and abuse do not deserve to serve in United Nations peacekeeping missions, and sends a clear message to troop- and police-contributing countries that fail to take action to prevent or punish credible allegations of sexual abuse and exploitation, as well as to all States Members of the United Nations and to United Nations bodies, to ensure that these investigations are carried out thoroughly, promptly and impartially.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I should also like to echo my French colleague's comment that the colour of the helmet means little to the victim.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: All of us, wherever we serve, whether we wear a blue or a green or some other colour helmet, have a responsibility to live up to the standards that this resolution tries to enshrine.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: All of us have a responsibility with respect to individuals who serve us overseas, in the same way that we have a responsibility within our own borders to ensure that these kinds of crimes are never carried out and that when they are carried out the perpetrators are held accountable.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The resolution adopted today endorses the decision of the Secretary-General to repatriate United Nations peacekeeping units that demonstrate widespread or systemic sexual abuse and exploitation, and it requests that the Secretary-General repatriate all uniformed personnel from a contributing country in a given mission if that country fails to take appropriate steps to address credible allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse, fails to hold the perpetrators accountable or fails to inform the Secretary-General of the status of such efforts.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I should like, if I could, to respond to Egypt's intervention.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We were accused, implicitly, politely, of having an ulterior motive.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I confess that I do have an ulterior motive.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: My ulterior motive is actually, finally, to do something about a cancer: the cancer of sexual exploitation and abuse against people who trust the United Nations flag.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: They see a peacekeeper coming their way and they think, this is someone who is going to help me; they do not think, I have to run, this is someone who is going to rape me.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That is not what they think.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That is not what they should ever think; but that is what they are going to think, and that is with some of them do think, because there is not accountability for the crimes committed that is in any way commensurate with what appears to be the scale of this problem.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: So that is my ulterior motive, I confess.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Sue me.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: I also take note of the very important comment that Egypt made, of the admission that the measures contained in the resolution - measures requiring accountability - would not have been passed by the General Assembly.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We agree; the General Assembly has been totally paralysed.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: There are countries within the negotiations that are going on as we speak that have tried to water down the recommendations that the Secretary-General has made.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It would be one thing if we were succeeding, if the system was working.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We come in here every day; we lament, we condemn.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We condemn the abuse and we condemn the lack of accountability, and then we go to the General Assembly and some of us try to water down provisions to try to strengthen the system.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: What is up with that?
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: One cannot simultaneously try to water something down in the General Assembly and then complain when the body that sends peacekeepers out to try to protect people actually takes responsibility for the fact that some of those who were supposed to do the protecting are committing sexual abuse.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We cannot have it both ways.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: If the General Assembly had been able to actually put in place methods for accountability, if the system were working for girls like the ones Matthew just quoted, who are now left with the children of the people who have come and raped them and then gone back to their countries never having been held accountable - if the system had prevented these kinds of acts, or least had some kind of accountability, we would not be having this conversation.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We are here only because it just keeps happening.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: So I think that it is very, very strange to hear Member States call on the one hand for more aggressive action or more accountability and then try to punt the issue to a body that for years has been unable to come to a consensus; and with several countries, again including countries on the Council, trying to water down what happens in the General Assembly, no reasonable person could expect a different result.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Let me conclude with two messages.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: To the tens of thousands of troops and police who serve honourably in United Nations peacekeeping operations, we salute them unequivocally for putting their lives on the line, with little fanfare or recognition, for people who live in countries far from their own.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We and the civilians that they protect with their bravery are completely indebted to them for their service.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: As I did yesterday (see S/PV.7642), I would single out those members of the Council that have contributed so many peacekeepers, including Egypt, Senegal, China, Uruguay and, of course, the United Kingdom, which is becoming involved again.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: As a country that does not contribute a lot of troops, we are in awe of their service.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: To the victims of sexual exploitation and abuse by United Nations peacekeepers, we pledge that we will do better.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We will do better to ensure that the Blue Helmets we send as their protectors will not become perpetrators.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: That is what we are striving for.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: But if they do, this resolution demands that we, the Council, ensure that the people who commit such violations, who violate the good name of the United Nations and the good names of their countries, be held accountable.
speaker: Ms. Power
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela voted in favour of resolution 2272 (2016), for we are convinced that acts of sexual exploitation and abuse committed by any foreign force or military, police or civilian personnel participating in United Nations peacekeeping operations or special political missions must be categorically rejected.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: No one can justify such cowardly and absolutely reprehensible crimes.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: All those responsible should be punished.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: In that regard, we reiterate our support for the Secretary-General's zero-tolerance policy.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: As we stated during the briefing yesterday (see S/PV.7642), this is not an issue of an exclusively disciplinary nature; these are reprehensible acts that contradict and undermine the purposes and principles of the United Nations for which peacekeeping missions are established.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: In situations of armed conflict, such acts could constitute violations of international humanitarian law and international human rights law.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The United Nations should be an example of consistency, firmness and high moral and ethical commitment with regard to the importance of preventing these acts and, above all, with regard to the accountability of any such personnel authorized by the Security Council that commits this type of crime.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Most of the interventions made yesterday stressed how important it was that the discussion and actions to be taken within the Council on this sensitive issue entaild close and organic coordination with other bodies with competence in the matter, namely, the General Assembly, in particular through its Special Committee on Peacekeeping Operations.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We want to insist on that point.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: The spirit of cooperation should prevail among the various organs of the United Nations.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: It is very dangerous for the Security Council to assume the powers of other bodies on the grounds of the latter's inaction.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: There should be mutual support since, by that same reasoning, other organs of the United Nations could take into their own hands the matters that fall within the competence of the Security Council, but which it has not been able to resolve in 25 or 60 years, and for which the inhabitants in the territories affected, for example, have been calling for more direct action by some organ of the Organization.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We also recognize that the scope of the resolution adopted today was improved by the incorporation of several proposals - for instance, in addition to peacekeeping missions, including also forces outside the Organization, which seems to us very important in order to be consistent with the idea of zero tolerance.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: However, as always, we would have wished for a more comprehensive and inclusive process in the discussion of this important resolution.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: This has become a recurring problem in the Security Council.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: In this spirit, we voted in favour of the proposed amendment submitted by the delegation of Egypt to paragraph 2, because we believe that it gives a sense of balance to the provisions therein and would preclude any arbitrary actions that could be committed against troop-contributing countries.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We would have wished as well that all members of the Council could have agreed on it without it having to be put to a vote.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: We recall that the unity of the Council demands that the views of its members be duly taken into account to the extent possible in the formulation of proposals.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: To avoid deficiencies, fragmented and bureaucratic responses to these cases, which the Organization has suffered from in the past, it is essential that the Council's decisions be guided by the principles of objectivity, non-selectivity and impartiality, and that the mechanisms and frequency of dialogue and coordination with countries that contribute military, police and civilian personnel be improved with a view to examining and discussing this issue, and to advancing concerted actions that have greater impact on prevention and the fight against impunity.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: With this resolution, the Security Council has taken up the flag in the fight against this type of act and is obliged to coordinate with troop-contributing countries.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS

sentence_text: Finally, we believe that it is not a question of stigmatizing countries, but rather a question of delivering justice.
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio
Subject: WPS
